His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a vehicle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Mme SALI est mariée et mère d’un enfant qui est âgé de 19 ans. Il va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Madame vend du jus depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché  de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de sucre, 01 sac de bissap et 02 paquets de sachets.
Les bénéfices du prêt seront utilisés pour améliorer son activité et acheter une parcelle. Elle  ambitionne aider son mari à payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Ms. SALI is a married mother with one child who is 19 years old and goes to school. She has three persons to support. Ms. SALI has been selling juice drinks for ten years. She gets her supplies at the market in her district. With the money granted, she intends to purchase 2 bags of sugar, a bag of bissap [dried hibiscus flowers], and 2 packets of pouches. The profits from the loan will be used to improve her business and purchase a parcel of land. Her ambition is to help her husband to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of sugar, a bag of bissap, and 2 packets of pouches

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf is a 48-year-old hardworking father of 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a motorcycle transport business, though he also farms to earn more income. 

Adolf faces the challenges of limited capital and bad roads, which cause him constant mechanical breakdowns and hence affect the progress of his business. Aside from that, he still hopes to buy a motor vehicle that will boost his income. 

Adolf has requested a loan to pay for labor and buy windows, cement, and sand to construct his house.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and buy windows, sand, and cement.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 41, married with six children and five of them attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like salt and sugar among other items. He earns additional income from owning a barber shop. He desires to expand and grow his business into a wholesale business. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock like soap, salt, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soap, salt, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

Mwanaidi has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat to her neighbors. In addition, she also operates a boutique shop. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and resell as meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and resell as meat.

loans.name: Wandemi Small Scale Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady holding a passbook in the photo  is Mary; a mother of 5 children. She is a 57 Years old and living with her family. She is a poultry farmer.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy chicken feeds for her poultry. She believes this will boost her enterprise by increasing eggs production thus more income that she will use to meet family needs.
Mary is happy about Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed to boost eggs production hence meet family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more  building materials to complete the house

loans.name: Mutumia Mwireri Group

texts.en:
The person on the right hand-side is Cecily, a member of Mutumia Mwireri Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training in enterprise development so that they can improve their enterprises through the skills they learned. 

She does vegetable and dairy farming and wants to buy animal feeds and manure to boost her farming. This will help improve productivity, thus bring in more income to cater for the family's needs.

Cecily is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and manure to boost farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter in Primary School

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been involved in a stitching business for many years. She also has skills in embroidery and has used her skills for many years to provide for her family.

During the initial years of her business, Naziran barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community, known to be the best at providing stitching and embroidery skills at reasonable prices. She makes beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

Now she has requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) to purchase a new sewing machine along with spools of threads in order to meet all of her orders on time. Naziran wishes to grow her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with spools of threads in order to meet all of her orders on time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, water, sweets, and snacks.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 55-year-old married man with ten children, six of whom attend school in Kasese, Uganda. Julius operates a general merchandise store along side farming to look after his family. He also has a clothing business that supplements his other businesses. He has been in service for 15 years and used the previous loan to buy rice, salt, millet flour, sugar and soap to sell.

Educating his children to university and finishing his family house are his dreams although price fluctuation is the greatest challenge he encounters. 

Julius has asked for a loan to buy rice, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Zubaria

texts.en:
Zubaria has successfully built her business of stitching with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Now she attains a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously with the help of Kiva, Zubaria was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more spools of threads, laces, zippers, buttons, etc. This will enable her to meet all of her customers’ orders on time and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, laces, zippers, buttons, etc. to meet all of her customers’ orders on time.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 33-year-old married woman who has successfully run a small general store with her husband in a corner of their house. She has many years of experience in this field.  Her husband also helps her by buying quantities of goods from a market where he has maintained many contacts over the years. Asma is the mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, and is requesting a loan for PKR 40,000 to buy salt, biscuits, flour, rice, sugar, beverages and other items to meet increased demand in her store. She is expecting to grow her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her home supplies business and to improve the standard of living for her kids.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 37-year-old married woman. She works in her home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for three years. She feels proud to be contributing to her household's income.

When Nazia was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis as her husband’s income was not enough to meet the expenses of their entire family, including their five children. That entire situation compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. She is a hard working woman and she enjoys a good clientele.

Recently, she has been facing difficulty in fulfilling large orders. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of threads, buttons, laces, zippers, etc. to meet the demand of her customers on time. She is hopeful that this loan will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, buttons, laces, zippers, etc. to meet the demand of her customers on time

loans.name: Wendlouimtaoré2 Group

texts.fr: Wendlouimtaoré02 vient de solder son premier crédit avec Kiva et sans difficulté. Fatimata, responsable du groupe est très contente et remercie kiva d'avoir financer son groupe. Après ses ventes, Fatimata a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de faire les dépenses de sa famille et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Au prêt passé, elle ne vendait que des habits mais elle pu associer du savon et de l'omo à son commerce maintenant. Elle voudrait encore un nouveau prêt pour augmenter le volume de ses activités. A l'issue de ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra d'aider son époux dans la gestion de leur famille et aussi faire une épargne.
texts.en:
Wendlouimtaoré02 Group has just repaid its first loan with Kiva without difficulty. Fatimata, the leader of the group, is very pleased and thanks Kiva for having financed her group. After her sales, Fatimata had a profit that allowed her to cover some family expenses and especially to grow her business. 

In the past loan cycle, Fatimata only sold clothing but now she has managed to incorporate selling soap and detergent into her business. She would like a new loan so that she could further increase her sales volume. After making the sales she will make a profit that will allow her to help her husband with the family finances and also have savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing and soap for resale

loans.name: Alfonzo

texts.es:
El señor Alfonzo es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene una pequeña despensa en la que vende todo tipo de productos, y con ello puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Él es una persona muy luchadora que se viene esforzando para poder mejorar cada día, es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder hacerlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, bebidas, panificados, lácteos y otros, y con ello poder surtirse para poder dar a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfonzo is from the city of Concepción. He has a small food pantry where he sells all types of products. This business gives him the means to help his family and his loved ones.

Alfonzo is a determined individual who strives to improve each day, which is why does everything he can to make things happen. He is requesting this loan in order to buy vegetables, meat, beverages, baked goods, dairy products, and other items. Alfonzo will be able to restock his business and provide for his family, just as before.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, beverages, baked goods, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Alba Rosibel

texts.es:
La Señora Alba de 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y habita en la comunidad de El Porvenir de Yamales Trojes, al oriente de Honduras y se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 10 años, es  propietaria de 20 vacas productoras de leche las cuales le producen 40 litros de leche diario.
Doña Alba esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra mas vacas ya que quiere incrementar las producción de leche que tiene hasta este momento.
Doña Alba cree que al incrementar su producción ella tendrá mayores ganancias ya que puede manejar mas ganado con el mismo tiempo y eso le produciría mejores ganancias.
Doña Alba sueña que su ganadería crezca hasta tener muchas mas vacas para tener un mejor patrimonio para su familia.

Trojes, Honduras - Marzo de 2015.
texts.en:
Sra. Alba is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She resides in the community of El Porvenir de Yamales Trojes, which is in eastern Honduras. Alba has been raising cattle for 10 years. She owns 20 dairy cows that produce 40 liters of milk a day.

Doña Alba is requesting a loan in order to buy more cows because she wants to increase her milk production and go above her current output. She believes that increasing her production will generate more earnings. Alba is able to manage more cattle while generating a better income.

Her dream is to grow her farm by adding more cows, which will create a better inheritance for her family.

Trojes, Honduras – March 2015

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Dhemar Alexander

texts.es: Dhemar de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo desde hace varios años. Él se gana la vida con su trabajo en una empresa cercana desde hace varios años, además su compañera de vida le apoya con los gastos económicos de su hogar. Dhemar desea ampliar su vivienda, ya que siente que viven en hacinamiento, por la falta de espacio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que desea terminar la mejora antes de las primeras lluvias de invierno.
texts.en:
Dhemar, age 23, has been living in his own home along with his life companion and their child for many years. He earns his living through his job at a company nearby where he has worked for several years. In addition, his companion helps with the household expenses.

Dhemar wants to expand his home because he feels overcrowded due to the lack of space. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in cement, gravel, bricks, and iron so that he can expand his home as soon as possible. Dhemar would like to complete this improvement before the first winter rains arrive.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, bricks, and iron so that he can expand his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to service his motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fish for processing and to resell

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Monica, who is in her early 30’s, is married with three children who are still at school.  She has had two projects, selling live pigs and a genge business, for one year now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Monica's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start a genge and also bought more pigs to sell. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy pigs and increase on the fruits and vegetables to sell.  She dreams of building her own house. 

Monica will share this loan with her loan group, "Iringa," which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. 

Florah is a tailor, a business she has done for 14 years and it has been profitable. 

Florah has asked for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase clothing materials and she looks forward to gaining more profits from this business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and provide food and other basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her buy animal feeds to feed her cattle for increased milk production for her customers.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 40 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. She has had a horticulture business for six years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help her generate income. Her hopes and dreams for the future are buy enough animal feed, educate her children and buy a water tank.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old. She is married to Meshach, a dairy farmer, and they are blessed with three children of 24, 20, and 17 years.

Mary has had a farming business for twenty years, earning a monthly income of KES 31,000. She has borrowed KES 40,000 as her second loan from VisionFund Kenya.

Mary will use her loan to purchase farm inputs such as green peas seedlings for planting, fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide, as well as hire laborers to work on her farm. She hopes that with the anticipated profit, she will be able to take care of her family's needs.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-thriving farming activity, secure a foreign market for exportation of green peas, and to enjoy an improved life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs as well as hire labourers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her increase number of litres of milk supplied

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders!

Meet Salina, 47, who has an enormous responsibility on her shoulders as the breadwinner of her family. She is a mother of four children who depend exclusively on her.

Salina is a hardworking mom and is aggressive with the principle of truth on her lips: she is honest and faithful to what she does and what she says.

Salina has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Salina is seeking a loan to buy land to expand her farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output.

Loans for smallhold farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. But a few organizations, such as Juhudi Kilimo, support farmers like Salina.

Salina has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, buying more land represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled.

In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallhold farmers like Salina because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the farming industry.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Esther, a smallholder livestock farmer who lives in Sambirir village, located in the North Rift area of Kenya.

Like most farmers from this region, Esther practises dairy and crop farming. She enjoys farming and she has aspirations of growing the business and providing a better life for her family.

Esther is seeking a loan to venture into sheep farming. Sheep are easy to keep. As well, sheep farming is important in the production of wool and, in Kenya, it is more important for mutton. Esther will be targeting the urban population and hotel industry to sell lamb.

Returns from this investment will help her to pay for the loan, to increase the number of sheep on the farm and to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en: Tausi is a 29-year-old married woman with one child who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a salon, which she started in order to earn her own income. She faces a large challenge in the form of competition that hinders the progress of her business. Despite that, she hopes to expand her business and finish the rental houses she built using the profits she earned. Tausi has asked for a loan to buy braids and relaxers to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy braids and relaxers to use in her hair salon.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old. He is married to Mary who is a farmer, and they are blessed with six children of ages between 23,  and 13 years. 
 
Charles has had a farming business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. He has borrowed KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his second loan after successfully repaying his first.

He has asked for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. With the anticipated profits he will be able to buy food for the family, pay school fees for his children, cater for family medical care as well as repay his loan. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to provide better education for his children as well as enjoy an improved life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like Irish potatoes, and at the same time he sells fresh foods in a busy market, which adds to his income. He is faced with challenges of weather changes that hinder progress of his business. He has asked for a loan to pay workers to weed his Irish potato plantation.

loans.use: to pay workers to weed his Irish potato garden.

loans.name: Africano

texts.en:
Africano is 37-year-old client. He is married with four children; three are in school. He operates a butchery at a trading centre near his residence. He has been taking loans from UGAFODE, which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet his family’s financial needs.

Africano applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy cows for slaughter at the butchery. Africano thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance, which has enabled him to build his house and pay fees for his children without affecting his business. He appreciates the ugafode and kiva partnership and is working hard to pay well in order to maintain the partnership.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas and sorghum for processing local gin.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 58-year-old widowed lady with one child. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells clothes and also has rentals that provide her with additional income. She is faced with challenges of competition that hinder the progress of her business. However, she hopes to have a good retirement from her work. Mary has asked for a loan to help her buy second-hand night dresses and bedding for selling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand night dresses and bedding

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en: Mimoza's husband, Vladimir, who is seen in the photograph with her, suffers from a chronic disease. He must go to do some further health examinations. This is the reason why Mimoza is seeking your compassion and financial help.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's health examination

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more supplies for his customers

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
A senhora Adelaide de 30 anos de idade é solteira e tem na sua responsabilidade  a sua mãe.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar cimento, areia, pedras, varões, barrotes e arrames para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O cliente tem como sonhos, concluir a sua casa e ampliar o seu negócio.
Tem como principais desafios os financeiros, tem recorrido ao xitique familiar e pretende tomar mais credito com a Hluvuku para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Ms Adelaide is 30 years old, single and is responsible for her mother.

With this loan she will buy cement, sand, stone, beams, bars and wire to continue building her house.

She dreams of finishing her home and expanding her business.

Her main challenges are financial ones and she has turned to a family savings group and also plans to request further loans from Hluvuku to take care of her needs.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, stone, beams, bars and wire to continue building her house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
A Sra. Teresa de 55 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 7 filhos dos quais 4 são independentes e 3 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário. Ela é pensionista da empresa de produção de banana é também agricultora de sequeiro cultura de milho, mandioca, amendoim para sustento famíliar.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado para compra de material de construção (cimento, blocos,pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Teresa is 55 years old and single. She has seven children, four of whom are independent and three attend primary and secondary school. She receives a pension from a banana company and she's also a dryland farmer. She grows corn, manioc and peanuts in order to support her family.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, rocks) and to pay for labor so that she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, rocks) and to pay for labor so that she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Jetrida

texts.en: Jetrida is a 52-year-old hardworking female, married with eight children, living in Kasese Uganda. For fifteen years, Jetrida has been selling cassava flour to get income to look after her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has a dream of educating her children, expanding the business and finishing her residential house. She wants money to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Lenders! The above picture presents to you Evelyn, 41, who is a loving mom and a hard-working farmer, committed to building a better life for her family. Evelyn is a go-getter and she hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a rural town on the slopes of the famous Mount Kenya. Together with her handsome husband, they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 20 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children. Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking kindly for a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. Evelyn’s upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Evelyn has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Evelyn is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda, a 28-year-old married mother of two, has a profitable tailoring shop. Emelda has requested this loan to purchase fabric and textile materials to make more dresses and clothes to sell to her customers. She will use the resulting additional income to educate her children and provide food for the family.

Emelda hopes to grow her business and open more tailoring shops, earn more income and be able to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To purchase textile materials for use in making dresses

loans.name: Sajja

texts.en: Sajja is 32 years old, married and the father of two children who are five and one. His older child attends school. He has applied for a loan for UGX 1,000,000 to buy coffee to sell to his customers.  Sajja started his business in 2008 with high hopes of earning enough income to look after his family. He also has a milling machine where he earns additional income. He works in Nyakabingo, Kakanju, Bushenyi District and his customers are all the nearby factories. He is a hardworking man who works for ten hours a day, six days a week but is faced with a challenge of limited capital which he hopes to sort out after getting a loan. Sajja is determined to boost his business and achieve his long-term dreams of becoming financially stable and finishing the construction of his house. He strongly believes that hard work pays.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a 47 year old married man with five children living in Fort Portal Uganda. Gideo sells produce such as maize and beans, and also operates a motorcycle transport service for additional income. His greatest challenge is unstable prices for agriculture produce.  

Gideon has requested this loan to buy beans to sell. He hopes to eventually have a fully stocked store and have all of his children achieve higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared was born and brought up in Kisii-Nyamira. He is married with two kids. He runs a business in Nairobi and is a trained electrician.

He is seeking a loan to put up a toilet in his residential home situated in the informal settlement. He owns a house and has one rental house in the same area.

He learned about the Fresh Life toilet through one of Fresh Life's staff who was doing marketing. He has resided in the area for a long time.
 
His intention is to improve the living standards of his family and that of the tenant. He will pay the loan through his rental income as well as income from his electrical business.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Rui

texts.pt:
O Sr. Rui de 30 anos de idade casado, pai de 2 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário. Ele é trabalhador numa empresa de segurança actividade esta que a exerce a mais de 6 anos, é também negociante informal de produtos da 1a necessidade actividade que esta  sendo acompanhada pela esposa, seus produtos vende a porta da sua casa  e por encomenda e faz cobranças no final de cada mês.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos da 1a necessidade (arroz, feijão, cebola, óleo, amendoim, caldos)e mais diversos produtos para aumentar o volume do  seu negocio.
texts.en:
Rui is 30 years old and married. He has two children who attend primary school. He works for a security company, a line of work he's been in for over six years. He's also an informal trader of products that are household staples, a business he runs alongside his wife. He sells his merchandise from home as well as on request, and he collects payments at the end of each month.
The current loan will be used to purchase household staples (rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, peanuts, broths) and various other products so that he can increase turnover in his business.

loans.use: to purchase household staples (rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, peanuts, broths) and various other products to increase turnover in his business.

loans.name: Aquimo

texts.pt:
O Sr. Aquimo de 59 anos de idade casado e pai  de 3 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário. Ele e pensionista Militar e também motorista de uma carinha escolar actividade esta, que exerce a mais de 7 anos.
Ele e cliente da Hluvuku a mais de 5 anos teve 3 empréstimo cujo valores foram aplicados para compra de material de construção para reabilitar a sua casa  e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar  material de construção para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condições de habitação e a dieta alimentar.
texts.en:
Aquimo is 59 years old and married. He has three children who attend primary and secondary school. He's a military pensioner and also a school bus driver, a line of work he's been in for over seven years.
He has been a client of Hluvuku for over five years. He has received three loans whose funds were used to buy construction supplies in order to repair his house. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies so he can continue building his house.
His big challenge is improving his living conditions and his diet.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 44 years old, married to Kamau, who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with three children aged 19 years, 17 years and 15 years old. She has had a farming business for 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES 35,000.

She has borrowed KES 10,000 as her fourth to pay school fees for her children . She hopes the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, purchase animal feeds, purchase seedlings, expand the current agro-business activity. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable agro-business activity,and also enjoy a better life with her family."

loans.use: to pay school fees for her kid in order to cater, for general boarding school amenities.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia has successfully built her hand-embroidery business with support from the Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She now has a good number of customers and makes a significant contribution to the family's income. She is requesting her fifth loan, for 45,000 PKR, to buy more beads, thread, sequins and pearls. This purchase will allow her to operate efficiently and gain more profits.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia, a 35-year-old married woman, has a business selling animals. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises and then sells them in the market at higher prices. Rabia makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate  extra income. 

Rabia needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses and so has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase more animals such as baby goats, calves, etc. to boost her earnings. With her experience and good contacts in the market, this loan will enable her to definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals like baby goats, calves, etc. in order to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 37 years old, married, and sells livestock with help from her husband, who we also see in the photo. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them while her husband makes sales in the local market. They make enough through their business to meet the day-to-day expenditures of their family, but need to earn more money to pay to educate their three children. Parveen has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to increase her income by buying more animals like baby goats and calves. They hope that this loan will help them expand their business and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Nhóm 8 Thôn 1 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Tân is the group leader of the Nhóm 8 Thôn 1 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.

Tân works in agriculture raising poultry. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns him is the lack of capital. He is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. This is Tân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tân is 26 years old and he is married with no children. In the future, Tân hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his children to find a good job, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne, aged 33, is from Kisumu town in Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports seven people in her family, including her three children. 

Anne has a retail shop which has been operating for the last four years and generates a monthly income of KES 18,000. She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD which she will use to purchase curios to sell to her customers in bulk. 

Anne will use the anticipated profit to grow her business. Her dream is to have a big business and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase curios to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A Sra. Rosa de 49 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino secundário. Ela é negociante informal de pão e biscoitos, actividade que esta a explorar a mais de 20 anos e com ajuda dos seus filhos. Seus produtos vende a porta da empresa de venda de material de construção.
Com  o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, Pedra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old and single. She has two children who attend secondary school. She's an informal vendor who sells bread and cookies, a business she's been running for over 20 years with the help of her children. She sells her products in front of a company that sells construction supplies.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, rocks) so that she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, rocks) so that she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and three go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She lives in rented house and the family and has access to piped water and electricity. 

She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years working six days a week. She gets additional income from selling charcoal. 

She has requested for a loan of UGX 1,900,000  from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenge includes seasonality of clothes and thieves. 

Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Chrisantus

texts.en:
Chrisantus is 60 years old, married to Jackline, and they are blessed with six children. He has been working  in the transportation field for the last 21 years and earns KES 7,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy another dairy cow which will enable him to supply milk for more income. He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy another  dairy cow which will enable him to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber for making assorted furniture for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted food stuff e.g maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat for use in the hotel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Damaris De Jesus

texts.es:
Damaris es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Santa Fe De Antioquia desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como almuerzos, desayunos, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Damaris y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Damaris desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina, un molino y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Damaris is a humble and hard-working woman that has spent a large part of her life caring for her children. She lives in the Santa Fe de Antioquia area where she is a spectacular cook. She runs a business in which she prepares food for lunch, dinner, and other meals.

She mostly sells her dishes to her neighbors who know the special flavors of her food. They know that they will always get delicious food that is very well prepared when they buy from her.

Damaria wants to grow her sales and also wants to work more comfortably. This is why she is seeking a loan; she will use it to buy various kitchen utensils and a grinder, and she will also buy ingredients so that she can continue making her dishes. She will buy chicken, flour, cheese, etc.

This loan will help her get by and earn the income that she needs to support her family. This opportunity is provided by Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy some cooking utensils and a grinder - also to purchase ingredients in order to continue making her dishes such as chicken, flour, cheese, and others.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a continuing client with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. She is a married woman with four children. She runs a stall that sells chicken in Kinawa Wakiso, 15 kilometers from the city centre. She has applied for a loan of ugx 800,000 to buy more chicken in order to boost her business. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have always offered to her and the people within her vicinity and above all look foward to accessing greater support today and in the near future.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 23 years old, married and has one child. He aspires to improve their living standards and give his family a better life.

Aside from planting and harvesting vegetables he also operates a truck to deliver gravel and sand and also fruits and vegetables. He would like to continue this business but he has limited capital. For this reason, he is asking for an additional of PHP 15,000 to buy spare parts, gasoline and accessories needed for the maintenance of his truck.

With this financial assistance, Jerry believes that he will continue to operate his business and generate sufficient income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and accessories needed for the maintenance of his truck.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay, 55, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sesame. She sells her agricultural products to local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD 5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Henriques

texts.pt:
O Sr. Henrique de 55 anos de idade, casado pai de 7  filhos dos quais 3 são independentes 4 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino secundário e primário, sustenta seus netos. Ele é agricultor formal numa Escola Superior, atividade que esta a exercer a mais de 20 anos, ele produz diversos produtos da machamba para os estudantes.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado para compra de material de construção  (cimento, pedra, área e varões )para reabilitara a sua  casa.
texts.en:
Henrique is 55 years old and married. He has seven children, three of whom are independent and four attend primary and secondary school. He supports his grandchildren. He's a professional farmer at a college, a business he has run for over 20 years. He grows various farm produce for the students.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, rocks, sand and rods) so that he can repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, rocks, sand and rods) so that he can repair his house.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 66 years old. He is married to Priscilla and they are blessed with six children. 

Patrick is a farmer, a business he has done for last 35 years, earning a monthly income of KES 55,000. He has borrowed a loan of KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying his previous loans. He will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, gum boots, and gloves, as well as milk storage containers. 

With the generated profits, he will be able to buy food for the family, pay school fees and repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable farming business and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, gum boots, and gloves, as well as milk storage containers

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is 49 years old and supports six family members. He has been felling trees and making timber out of them for the last 10 years and the business earns him KES 13,000 per month. 

Luka has applied for his first loan of KES. 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy another machine for making timber and meet the clients needs for timber supply.

He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children and to open up a timber yard station. His future hopes are to be financially stable and a rich merchant.

loans.use: to buy another machine for making timber and meet the clients needs for timber supply.

loans.name: Loreen

texts.en:
Loreen has a kiosk where she does money transfer services. She has been operating it for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

Loreen is taking her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to increase her working capital by adding float for money transfer.She successfully repaid her previous loan.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business further.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to increase her working capital by adding float for money transfer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. She sells firewood as well as grows cash crops such as maize and vegetables for selling.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use it to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to educate her children. 

In the future she hopes to add more dairy cows and expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 49 years old and supports eight members in her family. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last 10 years,earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 per month. 

Peterson has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. Through the milk sales, he will be able to add more stock to his retail shop and continue serving his customers to their satisfaction.

He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children and add more stock of retail goods like soft drinks, household goods and snacks. 

His future hopes are to be financially stable and occupy a larger niche in the market.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 33-year-old lady from the Kenya. 

She is a married woman who supports three people in their family and has three children.

Monica sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the last 4 years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add stock of cereals.These include rice, maize, beans and lentils inorder to meet the growing demand of her customers.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 30 years old man from Mamboleo region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports his wife and two children, four and six years old.

He sells clothing materials and has been in business for the last six years, generating a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more bed-seats, towels e.t.c .and pay some of his workers. He will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of expanding his business so as to be able to provide for his family needs.

loans.use: to purchase more bed-seats,towels e.t.c

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is thirty-three years old. She is married, and they have four children. She is a farmer and has been in business for four years. Her monthly income is 18,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting. She plans to use the profits to educate her children.

In the future, she aspires to have a dairy cow and to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a smallholder farmer based in Kenyenya, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Nyanza region. Jackline and her husband are blessed with a lovely family. 

Jackline has been a farmer for more than four years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. 

Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Jackline is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya. 

Jackline is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. 

This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Jackline seeks to continue growing a variety of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kenyenya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. 

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Uaminifu Ii Group

texts.fr: Madame Wakwetu est une femme ambitieuse vice-présidente du groupe de credit  Uaminifu II. Agée de 41 ans, elle est mère de 5 enfants  tous allant à l’école et mariée à un professeur. Elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter 2 douzaines de différente qualité de sac pour homme. Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Au final, elle émet le vœu de voir Hekima prospérer pour sa noble mission d’accompagner les femmes dans l’exercice de leurs activités commerciales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wakwetu, age 41, is an ambitious woman and the vice-president of the group Uaminifu Ii. She has five children who all go to school, and her husband is a teacher. 

She is seeking this loan to buy 2 dozen men’s bags in various grades. 

Her goals are to expand her business and support her children’s studies. 

Her wish is for Hekima to be successful in its noble mission of helping women to pursue their commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen men’s bags in various grades.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is aged 58 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 12and 25 years. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 17 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Uaminifu I Group

texts.fr: Madame Bitondo est presidente du groupe de crédit Uaminifu I. Femme dynamique et entrepreneur, elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée à un homme sans emploie et mère de 10 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle étale sa marchandise  au marché central de la ville depuis 2004.Ainsi,  elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour s’approvisionner en 20 tank en plastic, 10 tank en métallique et payer le transport jusqu’à l’entreprise.  Son objectif est d’agrandir son entreprise et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour ses services financiers auprès des femmes sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Mrs. Bitondo is the president of the loan group Uaminifu I. A dynamic and entrepreneurial woman, she is 39 years old, married to an unemployed man and is mother to 10 children, all in school. She has shown her merchandise at the city's central market  since 2004. So, she is asking for this new loan to supply herself with 20 plastic tanks and 10 metal tanks, and to pay for transport to the business. Her goal is to grow her business and to pay her children's tuition. She thanks Hekima for their financial services for women without tangible security.

loans.use: to supply themselves with 20 plastic tanks and 10 metal tanks, and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence is 49 years old. She is married with seven children aged 3 to 20 years; four of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 22 years, while her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who grow rice.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en el municipio de Sopetran.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.

Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida  a sus 2 hijos por los cuales aspira a darles un excelente futuro.

Trabaja sola durante 8 horas todos los días.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio.

Ella guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Maria is a very friendly person who always has a smile for her clients that visit her grocery store in the municipality of Sopetran. Thanks to her charisma and her good humor she has been able to win the hearts and the recognition of the people of her area who prefer to visit her store to acquire their products. Everyday she works to provide a good quality of living for her two children for whom she hopes to provide a good future. she only work 8 hours a day.

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of basic food items like grains, groceries, sweets and drinks amongst others. This will provide a significant boost to her business. She hopes to be able to continue with her business and continue to have an impact on the lives of her clients through her good service.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic food items like grains, groceries, sweets and drinks amongst others.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 43-year-old single lady with three children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She has a business of decoration and events management. She is faced with challenges of defaulters who hinder progress in her business, plus her business being seasonal. Besides that, she dreams of building a permanent house for her family.

Grace has asked for a loan to help her buy decoration materials to manage functions and events.

loans.use: to buy decoration materials to manage functions and events.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 37 years old. She is married, with four children aged between 4 and 15 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 19 years. His wife is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for growing rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who grow rice.

loans.name: Alba Del Socorro

texts.es:
Alba cuenta con una experiencia de más de 20 años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección directa en su casa desde hace 19 años.

Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades.
Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña.

La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos.

Prefiere trabajar sola durante 8 horas aproximadamente todos los días.

Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Alba requiere de un préstamo para Compra de insumos para confección como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, botones, entre otros, para abastecer su taller.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Alba has more than 20 years of experience in sewing. She has run a small workshop in her home for 19 years.

She works all day and in her workshop she strives to generate employment opportunities for low-income people. She learned how to do this work from her mother who began teaching her when she was very young.

The advantage is that she is already well-known in this industry and she provides very high quality products. This has enabled her to increase her customer base and has brought in many orders.

She prefers to work alone for 8 hours every day.

In reality, her production capacity is not enough to fulfill all of her customer's orders. Alba needs a loan so that she can buy supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, lace, buttons, etc. for her workshop.

Her biggest goal is make her sewing business successful and to be able to provide her household with better economic opportunities in order for her and her husband to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing work such as fabric, thread, needles, lace, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is aged 20 years old. She is married with two children aged 1 and 3 years that do not yet go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing rice for the past six years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her family's welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who grow rice.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is a 30-year-old married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. They offer a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store. Rafia deals with customers at their shop, while her husband brings stock from the market. They make enough profit to meet the basic necessities of their family.

To make their store fully stocked, they have requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour, salt, beverages, etc. from the market. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Rafia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour, salt, beverages, etc. to meet the increasing demand consistently.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly, aged 51 years, is married with 6 children aged 28, 26, 24, 22, 20 and 18 years, and all 6 attend school at the moment.

She has applied for a loan of 2,300,000 UGX (two million and three hundred thousand shillings only) to buy chicken feed and young chicks for her poultry farming business. Jolly does poultry farming as her major source of income, which she started in the year 1996 with high hopes of earning income to look after her family. 

Jolly also does agriculture where she earns income to supplement her monthly income. Her business is located in Bugarama and her clients are people in Bushenyi district. She is a hard working woman who works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week.

She is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations but is determined to excel in business through hard work. Jolly is determined to boost her business after getting a loan and achieve her dream of starting up a chicken brooder factory in the Municipality. She appreciates the loan facility.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben, aged 42 years, is married and has 8 children. He does coffee trading as his major source of income. 

He has applied for a loan of shs 5,000,000 to buy coffee for trading.  

He started the business in the year 2014 with high hopes of earning income to cater for his family needs. He also does cattle rearing to supplement on his monthly income. His business is located in his local area of residence in Ngorora, Mitooma District, and his clients are coffee traders. He is a hard working man who works 12 hours a day, but is faced with a challenge of limited capital, but hopes to have it sorted out after getting a loan. 

He hopes to become financially stable and expand his business in future. He is so appreciative of UGAFODE support.

loans.use: To buy coffee for trade

loans.name: Danelly

texts.es:
Danelly, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de La Ceja, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de planchas para el cabello, secadores y esmaltes de uñas de diferentes colores, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio además de que podrá ampliar su negocio y hacerlo más grande.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Danelly a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
Danelly, in her unending search of a better life and better economic stability, began a nail and hair salon in her home in La Ceja, an area where drive and ambition are very important qualities.

She works every day at various hours and she is always busy, as her services are in great demand.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy hair straighteners, dryers, and nail polish in different colors so that she can provide a better service to her customers and keep her business afloat. Further, she would like to grow her business and make her salon even bigger.

She is thankful for the success that she has had and for her work, which has enabled her to maintain stable employment.

With this loan you will be able to support Danelly so that she can continue working on her life's project!

loans.use: to buy hair straighteners, hair dryers, and nail polish of different colors.

loans.name: Neila

texts.pt:
A Sra. Neila de 38 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 3 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário, sustenta seus pais. Ela è negociante informal de roupas usadas e calcados, sua mercadoria vende porta a porta e na sua casa uma vez que ela não possui um estabelecimento fixo. Esta atividade que desenvolve a mais de 16 anos.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de fardos de roupa usadas para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio construir um estabelecimento comercial para melhorar as suas vendas.
texts.en:
Neila is 38 years old and single. She has three children who attend primary and secondary school, and she supports her parents. She's an informal trader of used clothing and footwear. She sells her merchandise door-to-door and from home, since she doesn't have a permanent store. She's been in this business for over 16 years.
The current loan will be used to purchase bundles of used clothing in order to increase turnover in her business.
Her biggest challenge is building a store so that she can improve her sales.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples so that he can increase turnover in his business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco habita en  la Comunidad de maquengales al oriente de Honduras, es casado tiene 3 hijos  y se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos desde hace 5 años, con esta actividad el suple las necesidades básicas del hogar.
Don Francisco esta solicitando el préstamo para realizar el proyecto de engorde y comercialización de cerdos con los fondos del préstamo el comprara Concentrado y vitaminas para sus cerdos, con este proyecto el espera que sus animales den mejor carne y se vendan a un mejor precio.
Don Francisco su sueño es que su condición de vida y la de su hogar sean cada vez mejor.


Trojes, Honduras - Marzo de 2015.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in the Maquengales community in western Honduras. He is married and has three children. He has had a business selling pigs for 5 years, and with this work he provides the basic necessities for his home.

Francisco is seeking a loan to fatten and sell his pigs, using the funds to buy concentrate and vitamins for his pigs. With this project he hopes that his animals provide better meat and are sold at an increased price.

Francisco dreams that his quality of life and home improve every day.

Trojes, Honduras - March 2015.

loans.use: to buy concentrate and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.pt:
A Sra. Zaida de 27 anos de idade, casada e mãe  de 1 filha que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primário. Ela é cabeleira a mais de 5 anos, actividade que esta a explorar na sua própria casa e è também negociante informal de produtos da machamba.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar produtos da beleza para dar continuidade com o seu trabalho.
texts.en:
Zaida is 27 years old and married. She has a daughter who attends primary school. She has been a hairdresser for over five years, a business she runs from her own home. She's also an informal vendor of farm produce.
The current loan will be used to purchase beauty products so that she can continue her work.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products so that she can continue her work.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
Venancia tiene 64 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en casa propia en una comunidad grande que se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como borregos, gallinas, patos y cuyes, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años, contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera Venancia espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y por ende poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Venancia is 64 years old, married, and lives with her husband in their own home in a large community that is known for business, agriculture, and livestock. The community is located in the Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

She has been raising and selling animals such as lambs, chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs for more than 5 years, resulting in experience in this business and steady customers who provide her many good personal and professional references.

She seeks a loan to buy a large quantity of animals and food to raise them. In this way Venancia hopes to grow her business, obtain more income, which means she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals and food to raise them.

loans.name: Bousso's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 18 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été mis en place le 20 avril 2010. la plupart des femmes s'activent dans le commerce et entretiennent de bonnes relations.
KHADY debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 20 ans, mariée et  mère 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et 2 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter de l’arachide pour transformer en huile et aussi des greffages  pour la coiffure.Avec les 25 000 FCFA du prêt elle achète de l'arachide pour faire de l'huile. Après transformation elle revend le litre à 900 FCFA.Le reste du prêt est utilisé pour la coiffure. Les greffages lui serviront à la coiffure qu'elle fait dans son village surtout pendant les cérémonies, ainsi pour chaque coiffure elle obtient 15 000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à assurer la scolarité des enfants mais aussi à épargner au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en: This group of 18 members is part of the Banc Villageois (Villagers' Bank) which was created on April 20th, 2010.  Most of the women are active in business and maintain good standing in the bank.  Khady, the woman on the right of the photo waving her hand, is 20 years old, married and is the mother of 5 children, 3 boys and 2 girls.  With the loan received, she will buy peanuts to transform into oil and also hair weaves for hair styling.  With the 25,000 FCFA loan, she will buy peanuts to turn into oil.  After the transformation, she resells the oil for a price of 900 FCFA per liter.  The rest of the loan is used for hair styling.  The hair weaves help her to do village women's hair during ceremonies, and for each hair styling, she receives 15,000 FCFA.  The income allows her to assure the education of her children but also to save up money in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and hair weaves

loans.name: Zanesi

texts.en: Zanesi is a 36-year-old, hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer growing Irish potatoes, maize, cassava and bananas. She also sells human drugs that add more to her income. She is faced with a challenge of little capital, which hinders her business expansion. Besides that, she has hopes of having a good monthly income and a healthy family. She needs a loan to plant Irish potatoes.

loans.use: to plant irish potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Akonkwa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Baderha est  présidente du groupe  Akonkwa. Agée de  40 ans, elle est  mariée  à un enseignant et mère de 7 enfants qui vont  à l’école. Vendeuse des articles divers dans la rue, elle commença le petit commerce grâce au soutien de son mari. Elle sollicite ce credit  pour acheter  1 bassin des tomates, 10 litres d’huile, les oignons et du sel. Son ambition est d’avoir son propre emplacement en terme de kiosque pour être bien identifié dans son activité.  Au finish, elle prie Dieu de bénir Hekima pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes pauvres à bas revenu.
texts.en:
Baderha, age 40, is the president of the Akonkwa group. She has seven children who all go to school, and she is married to a teacher. 
She is a street vendor who sells a variety of goods. She initially started this small commercial activity with her husband’s support. 

She is seeking this loan to buy one tub of tomatoes, 10 liters of oil, some onions and salt. 

Her goal is to have her own kiosk so that her activity may be easily identified. 

She prays for God to bless Hekima for its support of poor, low-income women.

loans.use: to buy one tub of tomatoes, 10 liters of oil, some onions and salt.

loans.name: Mapendo Group

texts.fr: Madame Wakulungwa  est trésorière de l’association d’affaire Mapendo. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 38ans, mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés et mariée à un  menuisier. Vendeuse d’aubergine depuis 2009, elle étale sa marchandise  dans la rue. Le prêt sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter 10 sacs d’aubergine et 2 bassins des tomates. Elle envisage le changement d’activité dans le but d’agrandir son entreprise. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wakulungwa, age 38, is the treasurer of the Mapendo business group. A dynamic woman, she has seven children who have all received schooling, and she is married to a carpenter. 

She has been selling eggplants since 2009. She sets up her booth by the curb. 

This loan will allow her to buy 10 sacks of eggplants and 2 tubs of tomatoes. She is adapting her commercial activity in order to expand her business.

She wishes to thank Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of eggplants and 2 tubs of tomatoes.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem has successfully built her business of cattle sales and purchase with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats and calves, etc. This will enable her to increase her sales to more customers and to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves, etc. to increase her sales to more customers and to earn more income for her family.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is 45 years old, married, and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  Nighat makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour, salt, beverages, etc. from the market. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  Nighat wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour, salt, beverages, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de arepas rellenas con pollo y queso.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por sus 5 hijos ya que es viuda y ellos son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Flor solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de ingredientes para sus preparaciones.

Con tu ayuda Flor Podrá salir adelante y mejorar su vida!
texts.en:
Flor is an enterprising and tenacious woman. She has worked hard to grow her business. she has a small business preparing and selling chicken and cheese stuffed arepas (a traditional dish). With this work she strives every day to get ahead and improve the living conditions of her family. She has 5 children and is a widow. Her children are the driving force in her life and her reason for fighting everyday to improve their lives.

Her greatest difficulty is the competition in her area of business, but with her great capacity for work she is capable of supporting herself and growing.
