texts.en:
Berta, age 43, is an enterprising woman who has been selling clothes for 15 years so that her children can get ahead. She also has the support her husband, who does metalwork. Berta lives in her own home along with her husband and their two children, ages 15 and 18. She wants to invest in her business because she knows that having more products to offer will result in better earnings.

For this reason, Berta is applying for a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of trousers, skirts, blouses, T-shirts, and other garments. This will help her earn more income and allow her to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, blouses, T-shirts, and other garments.

loans.name: Consuelo María

texts.es:
En el Cantón El Carmen su principal ingreso económico  es por el cultivo de  plátano, cacao, maracuyá, yuca y otros productos de ciclo corto. La zona es reconocida por el ecoturismo y la riqueza de su flora y fauna, goza de paisajes naturales extraordinarios,  esta zona goza de un exquisito clima tropical. 
En este lugar vive la señora Consuelo, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 18 años los mismos que estudian en el colegio. El cónyuge es chofer de un tráiler. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Consuelo es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cuidar un bebé. Trabaja en horario compartido: en la mañana, tarde o el día completo. Tiene ocho meses que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, a ella le gusta cuidar a niños y cuidar su hogar.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para pollos ya que va a iniciar este negocio. Tiene año y medio en el grupo de crédito y la invito la secretaria del Grupo De Crédito y actualmente es fiscal de pago y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho. Su sueño es terminar su carrera Universitaria.
texts.en:
In the canton of El Carmen, the main source of income is growing bananas, cacao, maracuyá (a kind of passion fruit), yucca and other short cycle products. The region is known for ecotourism and the richness of its flora and fauna. It enjoys extraordinary scenery and an exquisite tropical climate. 

This is where señora Consuelo lives. She is 38 years old and she is in a civil union from which she has two children, 16 and 18 years old. Both of them are in school. Her partner is a truck driver. They live in their own home. Doña Consuelo is a homemaker who takes care of a baby in order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses. She works a variable schedule: in the morning, the afternoon or the whole day. She has been doing this for eight months and it is going very well for her. She enjoys taking care of children and of her home. 

She is going to use this loan to buy chickens, feed and medicine for the chickens, since she is going into this business. She has been with the credit group for a year and a half, invited by the group’s secretary, and is currently a group monitor. She is very pleased because they have helped her greatly. Her dream is to finish the university.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine for chickens.

loans.name: Kairunsa

texts.ru: Кайрунса, 30 лет, она замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование-средне-специальное. Уже 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Кайрунсы есть 2 коровы и на 0,44 Га она выращивает картофель. Прибыль позволила Кайрунсе размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Кайрунса доходы от бизнеса планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Kairunsa is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a specialized-secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture (animal husbandry and crop farming) for ten years already.  She currently has two cows on her farm and she grows potatoes on 0.44 hectare of land.  Her income has helped her to increase the number of animals that she has on her farm and has improved her family's well-being.  Eager to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 (KGS) to buy two cows.  Kairunsa is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Puente De Hierro Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Puente de Hierro, es un grupo mixto integrado por un hombre por 2 mujeres (Florencio, Verónica, Placida), de la etnia miskita de Bilwi del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace aproximadamente un año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios de: Pulpería, venta de bastimentos y frijoles cocidos, incrementar su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Verónica: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora jovial de 48  años de edad, casada con 4 hijos que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como buzo. Desde hace 10 años vende verduras, frutas, bastimentos y frijoles cocidos en su tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: frutas, verduras, carbón y frijoles. Su sueño es tener una pulpería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Puente de Hierro" (Iron Bridge) is a mixed group made up of one man and two women (Florencio, Verónica, Placida), of the ethnicity Miskita of Bilwi of the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  All of them are entrepreneurs who got together about a year ago with the goal of accessing finance for their small businesses of general store, selling of provisions and cooked beans; increasing their sales, and thus be able to improve also their income that allows them to be able to cover the basic costs of their home; to ensure the education of their children; and to increase their businesses.

Verónica is a member of the solidarity group.  She is a jovial 48 year old woman.  She is married with four children who study in primary and secondary school.  Her husband works as a diver.   For ten years she has sold vegetables, fruits, provisions, and cooked beans in her stall that she has in one of the markets in Bilwi.  In this way, she contributes to the costs of home and the studies of her children.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruits, vegetables, coal, and beans.  Her dream is to have a general store.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, coal, and beans.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: Madame Machozi est une cliente ambitieuse, présidente de l’association d’affaire Tuungane  à l’âge de 42 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant et mère de 11 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Vendeuse  de longue date au marché centre de la place, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour acheter 1 carton de poudre et divers autres articles. Son rêve est d’agrandir son entreprise et renforcer sa capacité d’épargner. Elle remercie de vive voix HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Machozi, a  goal-driven person, is the leader of the Tuungane business association. She is 42 years old, married to an entrepreneur and the mother of 11 children, all of whom are in school. She has been working as a vendor at the central market in her town for a long time. 

She is seeking this new loan in order to buy one  carton of powdered [milk?]  and miscellaneous items. Her aim is to enlarge her business and bolster her savings. She expresses heartfelt thanks to Hekima for its support of women.

loans.use: to buy one carton of powdered milk and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, ham, cassava, cabbage, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 2 años y una hija mujer de 4 años, y su negocio es la agricultura.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, buena oyente, atenta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en ‘villa Tunari’ situada a 160 kilómetros al noreste de la ciudad, el comercio se reparte en hoteles y restaurantes como cafés, internet y tiendas generales. La oferta también se acerca a los deportes extremos, como rafting y parapente. De clima lluvioso y cálido con temperaturas de hasta 35 grados centígrados.
Eugenia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en la agricultura y con sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la agricultura; ella trabaja la tierra y siembra variedades de vegetales como; zanahorias, lechugas, zapallos, pepinos y otros, que según la temporada cambia de cultivo. “trabajo en la agricultura toda mi vida, ahora trabajo con mi pareja y juntos realizamos toda la cosecha…” comenta. El lugar dónde vive es un área que no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, anteriormente recogían agua del riachuelo, luego construyeron un pozo de donde extraen el agua, actualmente el agua llego al lugar y ya se puede realizar la conexión de agua potable. La ventaja de su negocio es que la tierra es fértil y todo lo que se planta se cosecha, la desventaja es la falta de servicios básicos. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos crezcan en mejores condiciones de vida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Eugenia solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos crezcan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her partner. They have a two-year-old son and a four-year-old daughter. Her business is in agriculture.

Eugenia is a good mother who is understanding, attentive, responsible, hardworking, and a good listener. She conducts her business in Villa Tunari, which is 160 kilometers northeast of the city. The businesses in the area are divided up among hotels, restaurants, Internet cafés, and general stores. This area also offers extreme sports, such as rafting and paragliding. The weather is rainy and warm, with temperatures that can reach 35 degrees Celsius.

Eugenia has a dark complexion, long black braided hair, brown eyes, a short stature, and a thin physique. She wears traditional apparel (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks in her town, but she also speaks Spanish as part of the general culture and to conduct her business. Eugenia shares her life with her partner, who also works in agriculture, and their two children who are not of school age. They live in a brick and cement house with a metal sheet roof. Their home receives well water and electricity. Her business is in agriculture. She works the land and plants a variety of vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, squash, cucumbers, and other produce. Eugenia plants her crops according to the change in season. “I have worked in agriculture my entire life. I now work with my partner and together we cultivate our crops,” she says. The place where she lives is in an area where not everyone has basic services. She previously had to collect water from a stream, but later on, she and her partner built a well where they now get their water. Now that she has water for her home, she is able to establish a running water connection.

The advantage of her business is that the land is fertile, so she is able to harvest everything she plants. The disadvantage she faces is the lack of basic services. Her dream is to finish the construction of her house. She wants to install a water connection to her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room so that her children can grow up in better living conditions. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender. Eugenia has been working independently at her business for five years.

For the reasons previously stated, Eugenia is requesting a loan so that she can establish a water connection to her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room in order for her children to grow up in better conditions.

loans.use: to establish a water connection to her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room.

loans.name: Maruja Liliana

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 46 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad donde los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, hace 08 años se dedica a esta actividad por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el sector. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos, patos, gallinas, pavos, entre otros, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ventas y por ende mejorará sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maruja is 46 years old and lives in her family home with her son in the district of Oyotún, a community whose residents work in agriculture, commerce and cattle raising. Oyotún is located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru.

Maruja has raised and sold ranch animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys, amongst others, for eight years so she has experience in this area.

Maruja is applying for a loan to buy a larger amount of pigs, ducks, hens, turkeys, and other animals to expand her business and satisfy the needs of her clients. This will generate an increased number of sales and as a result will improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of pigs, ducks, hens, turkeys, and other animals to expand her business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es estudiante de la carrera para policía y estoy en el  segundo año. Su carrera tiene la duración de cuatro años.
Al terminar su curso podrá tener el título de oficial ayudante, su meta es culminar su carrera para así poder ayudar a la ciudadanía y a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus clases, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Blanca is studying to be a policewoman and is in her second year. Her course lasts for four years and when she finishes she will qualify as a Deputy Officer. Her goal is to complete her course so that she can help citizens and her family.

Blanca is applying for this loan to pay for her classes so that she can continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she has received to continue improving.

loans.use: to pay for her studies

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es una persona muy sacrificada y concentrada en sus estudios, está estudiando la carrera de derecho, quiere ser una profesional útil para los demás.
Su meta es poder graduarse y seguir capacitándose por medio de otros cursos. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar los útiles que necesite para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lorena is from the city of Ybycuí. She is a person who has sacrificed and concentrated on her studies. She is studying for a career in law. She wants to be a professional who is useful to others.

Her goal is to graduate and continue training through other courses.  She is requesting this loan in order to buy tools necessary for her to continue her studies as she has done.

loans.use: to buy tools for college.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Lorena se recibió de Psicóloga, hoy está estudiando el masterado en psicología, con lo cual quiere poder ir mejorando sus conocimientos para poder dar un mejor servicio a las personas.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que ha hecho todo lo posible para mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
Lorena graduated in Psychology and is now studying a Master of Psychology so that she can improve her knowledge to provide people with a better service.

Lorena is a very self-sacrificing person who does everything possible to improve every day. She is applying for this loan to pay her course fees so that she can continue to improve every day.

loans.use: to pay her course fees

loans.name: Lenin Amilcar

texts.es: Lenin tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa que le apoya en su negocio,  su hijo de 9 años y su hija de 11 años los cuales se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, él se dedica a la fabricación de bloque y ladrillo desde hace 16 años, Lenin comenta que les va bien ya que brindan un buen producto y excelente servicio a sus clientes, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y tablones para la fabricación de los bloques, con este negocio Lenin aspira mejorar sus ingresos para seguir readecuando su negocio donde elabora bloque y así su producción sea más eficiente y eficaz y lo  más preciado para él es poder darle a sus hijos todo lo que necesiten sobre todo la educación.
texts.en:
Lenin is 35 years old and lives with his wife who helps him with his business. He has a 9 year old son and 11 year old daughter who go to school. 

Lenin has worked making blocks and bricks for 16 years. He tells us that it is going well for them because they offer their clients a good product and excellent service.

This loan will be used to buy cement, sand and tablets to make blocks. With this business Lenin aspires to improve his income to continue making improvements to his workplace where he makes blocks so that his production can be more efficient and productive. The most valuable thing for him is to be able to give his children everything they need, most of all an education.

loans.use: to buy cement

loans.name: Katty Mariela

texts.es: Katty tiene 36 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo, una hija de 10 años que asiste a la escuela y un hijo de 15 años el cual está  asistiendo al colegio, Katty se dedica a criar chanchos y trabaja de vendedora en una tienda y su esposo trabaja de chofer, el crédito lo va a invertir comprado chanchos, ya que esta es otra fuente de ingresos para su familia, Katty comenta que le va bien en su negocio y por este motivo va a renovar el credito. La aspiración de Katty es tener el dinero suficiente para darle a sus  hijos la alimentación y el estudio.
texts.en:
Katty is 36 years old and lives with her husband, her 10 year old daughter who goes to primary school and her 15 year old son who goes to high school. Katty raises pigs and works as a vendor in a store and her husband works as a driver. 

This loan will go towards the purchase of pigs since this is another source of income for the family. Katty tells us that her business is doing well and this is why she is taking out another loan. Katty's aspiration is to have enough money to provide her children with food and education.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Emmy's Group

texts.en:
Emmy, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of ten farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 44 years old, married and has six children.

Emmy likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She is also purchasing a solar light which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Emmy plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Emmy’s Group will receive 9 solar lights between them and the inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 66 years old, married to Pius, and they have been blessed with four children who are all in school. She has a retail shop, which she has been running for 14 years and currently makes a monthly income of KES. 7,000. 

She will be using this loan to purchase flour, sugar, rice and cereal for resale and hopes to generate more income to pay school fees for her children.

Her future hopes are to grow her business and open a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice and cereal for resale and hopes to generate more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Piedade

texts.pt:
A Sra. Piedade de 36 anos de casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário sustenta seus pais e sua irmã. Ela é funcionaria num orfanato exercendo as funções de servente a mais de 6 anos, é também negociante informal de produtos da 1a necessidade, actividade esta que sendo acompanhada pelos seus filhos e esposo a mais de 15 anos.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos da 1a necessidade (arroz, amendoim, manteiga, cebola, caldos, detergentes, frangos, peixe,para revenda. Seu maior desafio e aumentar o volume do seu negocio de modo a melhorar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Piedade is 36 years old, married and mother to three children who all go to either primary or secondary school. She supports her parents and her sister. Piedade is an employee at an orphanage and has carried out her duties as an assistant for more than six years. She is also an informal trader of basic needs products which she has done with the help of her children and her husband for more than 15 years.

This loan will go towards buying basic needs products such as rice, peanuts, butter, onions, soups, detergent, chicken, and fish to resell. Her biggest challenge is to increase the output of her business to improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products (rice, peanuts, butter, onions, soups, detergent, chicken, fish and a variety of other products)

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un hombre de 34 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos varones de 12, 14 y 4 años y 3 hijas mujeres de 8, 6 y 1 año, y su trabajo es la agricultura.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, contante, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en el ‘Chapare’ un zona rural de superficie boscosa, considerada una de las cinco regiones con mayor precipitación pluvial del mundo, a una altura de 2558 metros de altura sobre el nivel del mar, de clima tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 24-35 grados centígrados.
Santiago es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la disfruta junto a su esposa que trabaja en la agricultura y con sus hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela, los 2 menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para acceder a agua deben dirigirse al arroyo que queda a 10 minutos de distancia de caminata. Su trabajo es la agricultura y posee cultivos de frutas y verduras, como; piña, papayas, plátanos, manzanas y otros. Actividad que realiza durante la semana, los domingos debe recoger agua del arroyo para utilizar en la semana. “el clima del lugar hace que la fruta se coseche y se venda a buen precio, tengo clientes constantes porque vendo por mayor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la fertilidad de la tierra y las buenas cosechas que obtiene, la desventaja es que su casa no tiene agua y recoger agua es un trabajo familiar. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo que cuente con todos los servicios básicos, él desea realizar la conexión de agua a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia no beba agua de rio.
Es por esos motivos que Santiago solícita un préstamo para realizar la conexión de agua a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia no beba agua de rio.
texts.en:
Santiago is a 34 year old man who is married and has three sons of 14, 12 and 4 and three daughters of 8, 6 and 1 year old. He works in farming. Santiago is a good father, enterprising, persevering, responsible and hard working. He works in the Chapare, a wooded rural area which is considered to be one of the five regions of the world with the highest rainfall. It sits at 2558 metres above sea level and has a tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 24 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Santiago is dark skinned and brown eyed with short black hair and average build. His native language is Quechua which is spoken in his area and he also speaks Spanish out of general knowledge and because of his job. He enjoys his life together with his wife who works in farming and with his children. The eldest study at school while the two youngest are not yet school aged. They live in their own home made of wood with a corrugated iron roof. The house has electricity but to access water they have to go to the river which is a 10 minute walk away. 

Santiago works in farming and grows fruit and vegetables such as pineapple, papayas, plantains, apples, and others. He carries out this job during the week and on Sundays he has to get water from the river to use throughout the week. He says "the area's climate readies the fruit for harvest and it sells at a good price. I have constant customers because I sell in bulk." The advantage of his business is the fertility of the soil and the good harvest he obtains. The disadvantage is that his house doesn't have water and collecting water is a family job. 

Santiago's dream is to build a brick house which has all of the basic services. He would like to connect water to the kitchen, bathroom and laundry so his family don't have to drink water from the river. It is for these reasons that Santiago is applying for a loan.

loans.use: to connect water to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry so that his family don't have to drink water from the river

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 6 y 3 años, y su negocio es la agricultura.
Él es buen padre, generoso, constante, emprendedor, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de el ‘Chapare’ un área rural donde se produce verduras, frutas y se cría ganado. Las casas del lugar son rústicas y la mayoría no cuenta con servicios básicos, son las residencias de los agricultores que utilizan cuando sacan sus cosechas para vender a la ciudad. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-27 grados centígrados.
Jose es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja la tierra y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y madera con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para obtener agua deben aproximarse al arroyo que se encuentra a una distancia de 10 minutos caminando. Su negocio es la agricultura, específicamente la producción de papa, trigo, quinua, cebada, habas, arvejas y cereales, también cuenta con ganado ovino. “anteriormente vivía en el pueblo, al ver que la agricultura estaba generando buenos ingresos me trasladé al campo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que toda su producción se vende, la desventaja es que en el pueblo donde vive no tiene acceso a servicios básicos. Su sueño es contar con todos los servicio básicos en su hogar, el desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para ofrecerle a su familia un hogar seguro. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para brindarle a su familia un hogar seguro.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old, and he lives with his partner.  He has two sons, ages six and three, and his business is agriculture. 

He is a good father, and he is generous, persevering, enterprising, independent, responsible, and hardworking.  He carries out his business in the locality of the “Chapare”, a rural area where fruits and vegetables are produced and livestock is raised.  The houses in the area are rustic, and most are without basic services. They are the farmers’ houses, which they use when they are harvesting their crops to sell in the city. Its climate is mild, with temperatures that vary between 18 and 27 degrees centigrade during the day.

José has tan skin, short black hair, and dark eyes. He is short of stature, and slightly built. His maternal language is Quechua, which he speaks at home; he speaks Spanish with the general public and for business.  He shares his life with his partner, who works the land, and with his sons—the eldest, who is studying in school, and the youngest, who is not yet school-age.  They live in their own house, built of adobe and wood, with a corrugated iron roof, and electricity. To get water, they must go to the stream, which is ten minutes’ walking distance.

His business is agriculture, specifically, the production of potatoes, wheat, quinoa, barley, broad beans, peas, and grains. He also has sheep.  “Before, I lived in the town; upon seeing that agriculture was generating good income, I moved to the country…” he says.  The advantage of his business is that all of his production sells; the disadvantage is that he doesn’t have access to basic services in the town where he lives.  His dream is to have all the basic services in his home; he wants to install a potable water connection in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, in order to offer his family a safe home.  This is his first loan with the institution in the ten years that he has been doing this work. 

That is why José is requesting a loan: for the installation of potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room in order to provide a safe home for his family.

loans.use: to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, in order to provide a safe home for his family.

loans.name: Rosemberg

texts.es:
Rosemberg de 74 años edad, solo estudió hasta tercer grado, actualmente está acompañado y tiene dos hijos que ya están casados y son independientes.

Rosemberg trabaja en la agricultura desde muy joven, ya que su padre se dedicaba a la misma actividad, actualmente cultiva dos hectáreas de maíz y jícama. 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar una yunta de bueyes que le servirán en los trabajos agrícolas que realiza.

Él sueña con sacar buenas cosechas y que la yunta de bueyes le sea de mucho provecho.
texts.en:
Rosemberg is 74 years old and only studied until the 3rd grade. Now he lives with his wife and has two children that are already married and independent. 

Rosemberg has worked in agriculture since he was very young, since his father used to work in the same business. He currently grows two hectares of corn and jicama. He needs this loan to buy a pair of oxen that will be useful to him in his agricultural work. He dreams of getting good harvests and that the pair of oxen will be greatly beneficial for him.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen that will be useful to him in his agricultural work.

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Wakusolela est présidente du groupe Gloire à Dieu à l’âge de 65 ans. Veuve de son état, elle est mère de 4 enfants dont seulement 2 sont encore sur le banc de l’école. Elle s’occupe de la vente de farine de manioc  depuis 2006 grace au premier fonds reçu de Hekima. Elle vient de solliciter un nouveau credit pour acheter 100kg de farine. Son rêve est de bien évolué dans ses affaires. C’est pourquoi, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son grand soutien.
texts.en:
Wakusolela is the president of the 'Gloire à Dieu' (Glory to God) Group.  She is 65 years old, widowed and mother to four children, two of whom still attend school.  

Wakusolela has been selling cassava flour since 2006 thanks to initial funding provided by the field partner, Hekima.  She has requested this new loan to buy 100 kgs of flour.  Her dream is to succeed in her business and she is grateful to Hekima for the great support that they offer.

loans.use: to buy 100 kgs of flour for resale.

loans.name: Rugwasanye Group

texts.fr: Madame Cikuru est une femme forte, ambitieuse et courage de Rugwasanye, une association de crédit. Elle est âgée de 42 ans, mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés et mariée à un artiste. Elle commença avec Hekima en 2007 au marché central de la ville où elle étale sa marchandise. Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour acheter 1 carton des piles. Son objectif est de prospérer dans ses affaires et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien.
texts.en:
Cikuru is a strong, ambitious, courageous woman, and a member of the Rugwasanye loan association.  She is 42 years old, mother to three school children and married to an artist.

Cikuru began her business with the support of the field partner, Hekima, in 2007 with a stall at the central market in town.  She has requested this new loan to buy one box of batteries for resale.  Her goal is to be successful in her business and provide for the education of her children.

Cikuru is grateful to Hekima for the support that they offer.

loans.use: to buy one box of batteries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to increase the number of liters supplied to his customers each day.

loans.name: Manasseh

texts.en:
Manasseh is 47 years old and has one eye. He is married with three children between 4 and 18 years old and they all go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for 25 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Karibu Group

texts.fr: Muhaya est une commerçante, membre d’un groupe de crédit «Karibu », âgée de 38 ans, mariée à un agent d’une organisation de la société civile, mère de 6 enfants dont 5 scolarisés et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse de la boisson sucrée à domicile dans une avenue animée depuis 4 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 12 caisses de la boisson sucrée.  Ainsi, il souhaite renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique. Nous tenons a signaler que certaines clients portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Muhaya is a retailer and a member of the loan group Karibu. She is 38 years old, married to a civil servant, and the mother of 6 children, 5 of whom go to school and one of whom who is still too young to attend. She has been selling sweetened drinks from her home on a busy street for 4 years. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so that she can increase her business. She is going to buy 12 cases of sweetened drinks. She would like to strengthen her funds and to feed and educate her children. She thanks Hekima for the support it gives to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

Please note that some of the clients in the picture are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 12 cases of sweetened drinks.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 27-year-old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He sells cattle and is also a farmer. 

He faces challenges of improper pastures and water for his animals, especially after the prolonged drought. 

He dreams of having enough capital and a healthy family. David needs a loan to buy cattle to resell for the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Tabita Group

texts.fr: Milama est commerçante et présidente de la banque communautaire Tabita, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 44 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous  scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est sociétaire d’une maison des pièces de rechange depuis 15 ans. Elle va acheter les pneus, amortisseurs, segments, coussinets et les huiles moteurs. Son conjoint est un pasteur d’une église locale. Elle souhaite clôturer sa parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Milama is a retailer and the leader of the community bank Tabita. She is a customer of the MFI Hekima, married, 44 years old and the mother of 6 children who all go to school. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been a member of a company which sells spare parts for 15 years. She plans to buy tyres, shock absorbers, parts, pads and motor oil. Her husband is a priest at a local church. She would like to fence off her plot of land and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy tyres, shock absorbers, parts, pads and motor oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 350 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Mkono Mkononi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Efrasie est commerçante,  présidente  de la banque villageoise Mkono Mkononi, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un maçon, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 12 enfants dont 7 scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des  divers produits manufacturés à son domicile depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter  des biscuits, piles, savon Omo, huiles, sucre, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler qu’’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Efrasie is a retailer and the leader of the Mkono Mkononi "banc villageois." She is a customer of the MFI Hekima, married to a mason, 46 years old and the mother of 12 children, 7 of whom attend school. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling various manufactured products from her home for 6 years. She plans to buy various items including biscuits, batteries, Omo soap, oils and sugar. She would like to increase her credit and ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

Please note that one of the customers in the picture is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, Omo soap, oils, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gentian

texts.en:
Gentian is not yet finished with the house he is building in the village and he is seeking your financial help. 

"Once we start living in the village, we will start our livestock/agriculture thing; we believe, that money-wise it will be much better for our family. Well, raising our kids in the village, it will be much better too comparing to raising them in the city," said Gentian.

loans.use: to finish building the house and to start an agriculture/livestock business.

loans.name: Tenez Bon B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Anne marie est une commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Tenez Bon B», âgée de 43 ans, veuve, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 2 ont abandonné les études. Elle est vendeuse de divers pagnes  au marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 100 pièces des pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Anne-Marie is a retailer and a member of the "Tenez Bon B" loan group. She is 43 years old, widowed and the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom attend school and 2 of whom have dropped out. She sells various pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) at the market in town. She is requesting a loan from the MFI Hekima in order to increase her business. She plans to buy 100 pagnes. She would like to build a house and ensure that her children are fed and educated. She thanks Hekima for the support it gives to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy 100 pagnes.

loans.name: Tenez Bon A Group

texts.fr: M'Chirimwami est commerçante,brave femme, membre du groupe  d’affaires «Tenez Bon A», âgée de 70 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants , dont 1 étudie et les 5 autres sont déjà grands. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché de la ville depuis 17 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 10 ballons de friperies pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds après avoir vendu sa parcelle. Dans l’avenir, elle compte scolariser, nourrir et vêtir son enfant cadet. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: M'Chirimwami is a retailer, a strong woman and a member of the "Tenez Bon" business group. She is 70 years old, widowed and the mother of 6 children, only one of whom attends school as the others are already adults. She had been selling second-hand clothing at the market in town for 17 years before requesting a loan from the MFI Hekima. She plans to buy 10 bales of second-hand clothing in order to increase her business, which she started with funds she got from selling her land. In the years to come, she plans to feed, clothe and educate her youngest child. She would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to small, non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 10 bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 42 years old. She is married 4 with children aged between 6 and 17 years, all of whom go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for 20 years, while her husband is a business man. 

With this loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be uses to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy replacement parts and pay for maintenance of his business vehicle.

loans.name: Geovani Maximiliano

texts.es:
Geovani es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, se graduó de bachillerato en el 2014, actualmente trabaja y estudia y vive junto con sus padres. 

Él trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años, actualmente se dedica a ayudar a su abuelo a pastar ganado, de esta forma gana un poco de dinero para ayudar a sus padres y para pagar sus estudios.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar dos novillos y pastarlos.

Como todo joven,  Geovani tiene muchas metas, espera lograr ser un profesional, seguir ayudando a su abuelo, a sus padres y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Geovani is a 22 year old entrepreneur. He graduated from secondary school in 2014. Right now he is working and going to school. He lives with his parents. 

He has worked in agriculture for 12 years. Right now he is helping his grandfather graze cattle. This way, he earns a little money to help his parents and to pay for his education.

He needs the money from the loan to buy two calves and graze them. 

Like any young man, Geovani has a lot of goals. He hopes to graduate from college, keep helping his grandfather and his parents, and to start his own family.

loans.use: to buy two calves and graze them.

loans.name: Tonin

texts.en:
Tonin is in the photo with his wife, Flora. In the background of this photo is a little type of farming hutch that in their case will be used to house chickens. 

They want to expand their poultry activity, so to have the chickens out they need to build a fence around this hutch. For this, they need your financial help.

loans.use: to build a fence around the hutch of the chickens

loans.name: Tujenge Group

texts.fr: La cliente Donatia est commerçante, membre  d’un groupe  d’affaires «Tujenge», âgée de 62 ans, veuve, mère de 8 enfants dont 4 étudient et 4 ont terminé leurs études. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires.  Elle étale sa marchandise à son domicile dans une avenue mouvementée. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son salaire. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de maïs, 1 sac manioc etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.Nous tenons a signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Donatia is a retailer and a member of the Tujenge business group. She is 62 years old, widowed and the mother of 8 children, 4 of whom go to school and 4 of whom have already finished their education. Donatia sells groceries. She displays her merchandise at her home located on a busy street. She started her business with income she saved from her previous job. She has been in this line of work for 4 years. This new loan will be used to buy food including 2 bags of maize and a bag of cassava. She would like to ensure that her children are fed, clothed and educated. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping to make non-bankable women entrepreneurs self-sufficient.

Please note that some of the customers in the picture are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of maize, 1 bag of cassava, etc.

loans.name: Israël Group

texts.fr: Habimana est une brave femme, membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Israël», âgée de 45 ans, mariée à un cultivateur, mère de 8 enfants dont 4 étudient, 2 sont mariés et 2 sont gosses. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché secondaire de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  après récolte dans son champ. Il y a 26 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de  pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Habimana is a good woman and a member of the Israël business group. She is 45 years old, married to a farmer and the mother of 8 children, 4 of whom attend school, 2 of whom are married and 2 of whom are very young. She sells groceries. She displays her merchandise at a small market in town. She started her business with the profits she made from selling produce grown in her field. She has been in her current line of work for 26 years. This new loan will be used to buy 3 bags of potatoes. She aims to ensure that her children are fed, clothed and educated. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping non-bankable women entrepreneurs become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Sujaa Group

texts.fr: Mambo est une commerçante, présidente d’un collectif d’affaires «Sujaa», âgée de 45ans, mariée à un homme d’affaires et mère de 6 enfants dont 5 scolarisés et 1 encore petit. La cliente est propriétaire d’un atelier de couture et vendeuse des divers matériels de couture à son domicile dans un quartier de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu son mari depuis 5 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter un tissus, un rouleau fil, boutons, etc. Ainsi, elle compte acheter une parcelle, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables. Nous tenons a signaler qu'une cliente porte son enfant.
texts.en:
Mambo is a merchant and president of the business group Sujaa. She is 45 years old, married to a business man, and is the mother of six children. Five of the children go to school, while one is still too young.

Mambo owns a sewing workshop and sells various sewing materials from her home in a local part of town. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband five years ago. This new loan will serve to buy fabric, a roll of thread, buttons, etc. 

Mambo wishes to buy some land, and school, clothe, and feed her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping women, who lack access to financial services, become independent. 

Note that there is a client who is holding her child [in the photo].

loans.use: to buy fabric, a roll of thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Uwe Macho Group

texts.fr: Claudette est commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise Uwe Macho, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un artiste, âgée de 37 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Elle est vendeuse de diverses denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans le quartier commercial depuis son jeune age. Elle va acheter la farine de manioc, de maïs, savons Omo, épices arachides, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Claudette is a retailer and the president of the Uwe Macho "banc villageois." She is a customer of the MFI Hekima, married to an artist, 37 years old and the mother of 6 children who all go to school. She started her business with funds she received from her parents. She has been selling various grocery products from her home located in a commercial district from a very young age. She plans to buy products including cassava flour, maize, Omo soap, spices and groundnuts. She would like to increase her credit and ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for its support of non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, maize, Omo soap, spices, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Fahamu Group

texts.fr: Messi est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Fahamu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 35 ans, mère 3 enfants tous  étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de sa grand mère. Elle est vendeuse des poissons fumés dans un marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Messi is a merchant, a client of the micro-finance institution Hekima, and a member of the banque communautaire Fahamu. She is 35 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children, who all go to school. 

Messi has sold smoked fish in a town market for 15 years. She started this business with funds that she received from her grandmother.

[With this loan], she is going to procure fish. 

Messi wishes to build a house, and school and feed her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Dynamique Group

texts.fr: Pelagie est commerçante, secrétaire de la banque villageoise Dynamique, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un enseignant, âgée de 55 ans, mère de 3 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de son fils. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis 1 an. Elle va acheter 15 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Pelagie is a merchant, a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima, and the secretary of the banque villageoise Dynamique. She is 55 years old,  married to a teacher, and is the mother of three children, who all go to school. 

Pelagie has been selling used shoes at the central town market for one year. She started this business with funds that she received from her son. [With this loan], she is going to buy 15 pairs of shoes. 

She wishes to obtain more loans, and educate and feed her children. 

Finally, Pelagie thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Pacifique Group

texts.fr: Kandinao est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Pacifique», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 50 ans, mère 6 enfants dont 1 étudie et 5 sont déjà grands. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle est vendeuse des poissons fretins dans un marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons fretins. Elle souhaite accroitre ses activités, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kandinao is a mercahnt, a client of the micro-finance institution Hekima, and a member of the banque communautaire Pacifique. She is 50 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children. One of the children goes to school, while the others are already grown. 

Kandinao has sold small fish in the town market for 15 years. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband while he was still alive. 

[With this loan], she is going to procure small fish. 

She wishes to increase her business, and feed and school her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to procure small fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 36 years old, is married to Michael, and they have been blessed with five children who are in school. She sell fruits and vegetables and it has been profitable. Her spouse is a farmer and supports them with additional income for the family.

She will use the loan to add more stock of vegetables, mangoes and bananas to sell, and hopes this will enable her to make more income to educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to expand her business by opening a grocery store, and to be successful.

loans.use: To add more stock of vegetables, mangoes and bananas

loans.name: Johnstone's Group

texts.en:
Johnstone is 55 years old and has seven children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Johnstone is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Johnstone started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

Johnstone is also purchasing a solar light, which he is very excited about because it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, therefore saving more money. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Johnstone’s Group will receive a total of 10 solar lights among them and farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is aged 34 years old. She is married with two children, aged 4 and 8 years. They both go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 18 years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be uses to pay medical insurance and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila's existing stable is been damaged and she must repair it; to do this, she needs your financial help again. 

She stated that she would very much would appreciate it.

loans.use: to repair the stable of ten sheep and a goat

loans.name: Mtendere Group

texts.en:
A mother of three children, Doreen sells plastic plates, basins and cups to her nearest market. She runs this business in order to find adequate funds for supporting her family by providing them with basic needs and paying their medical bills. 

Doreen will use the loan to buy more materials in order to expand her business. 

She hopes of owning a restaurant one day, and dreams of building a permanent dwelling house. There has been a positive change since she started obtaining the loans, as she now to provide food to her children three times.

loans.use: to buy plastic plates and basins

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER 15 DE AGOSTO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco

La socia Nataly se dedica al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.



La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank "Amanecer 15 de Agosto". The bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, belonging to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Nataly makes a living with her restaurant business. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and chipped beef. She works from 8 in the morning until 6 at night, and she already has 8 years working in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. Nataly is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She is very happy for the loan and promises to complete the payments of her quota.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Fraternel Group

texts.fr: Furaha est une commerçante, conseillère de la banque villageoise «Fraternel», âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 4 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse divers pagnes et draps de lit au marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 100 pièces de pagnes et 25 draps de lit depuis 6 ans. Ainsi, elle souhaite augmenter ses activités, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Furaha is a retailer and an advisor to the Fraternel "banc villageois." She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 8 children, 4 of whom are going to school and 4 of whom are married. She has been selling various pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) and sheets at the market in town for 6 years. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so that she can increase her business. She will buy 100 pagnes and 25 sheets. She would like to increase her business and ensure that her children are fed and educated. She thanks Hekima for the support it gives to female entrepreneurs excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy 100 pagnes and 25 sheets.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 52 years old. He is married with three children, aged between 6 and 21 years. All of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 30 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be uses to buy a cow and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno is a 43-year-old married man with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing maize, and at the same time has a business of beekeeping and poultry farming that gives him more income. 

He is faced with challenges of limited capital that hinder the progress of his produce business. Besides that, he has a plan of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Bruno needs a loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 52 years old. He is married with three children aged between 6 and 21 years. All of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 30 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. 

The profits from the business will be uses to buy a cow and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Respect Group

texts.fr: Jaenne est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, trésorière du groupe solidaire «Respect», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 58 ans, mère 7 enfants dont 2 étudient et 5 ont fini leurs études. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de sa famille. Elle est propriétaire d’une quincaillerie sur la route principale de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va acheter des tôles, clous ciments, tuyaux, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Jaenne is a retailer who works together with her husband, and she is the treasurer of the Respect solidarity group. She is a customer of the MFI Hekima, married, 58 years old and the mother of 7 children, 2 of whom still attend school and 5 of whom have already finished their studies. She started her business with funds she received from her family. She has been the owner of ironmonger shop located on the main road to town for 2 years. She plans to buy items like sheet metal, nails, cement and pipes. She would like to increase her turnover and ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for its support of non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, nails, cement, pipes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy personal higiene supplies, women's accessories, and food such as rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a 40-year-old married lady with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer growing bananas that she uses to brew waragi and at the same time, she rears pigs that add to her income. 

She is faced with challenges of limited capital and high license fees charged to alcohol dealers. However, she has hopes of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. 

Hope needs a loan to brew waragi, a local drink to sell.

loans.use: to hire kisubi plantation and brew waragi, a local drink to sell.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte needs your financial help again; this time she must pay the electricity arrears. She has had no electricity since last September, according to her. 

Kindly note that the energy company, the only one here in Albania, suffered operational problems and due to this, some households and businesses were asked to overpay, some to not pay at all. Corruption, the whole thing, was very unfortunate. 

Many villagers have been left in dark since last summer; they have no money to pay the lump sum that is requested of them.

loans.use: to pay the electrical arrears

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 71 years old, is married, and has 10 children.

Daniel likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. 

He is also purchasing a solar light which is so exciting to him since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life. 

Daniel plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Daniel’s Group will receive 9 solar lights between them and inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of seven farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 48 years old, is married and has six children.

Martha likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. 

This year, Martha is purchasing a solar light, which she is so excited about because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Martha plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Martha’s Group will receive six solar lights between them and inputs to cultivate 3.25 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es: Doña Yansi es una mujer con 34 años, casada y tiene tres hijos. Es nacionalizada costarricense. Ella es de nicaragua pero tiene muchos años de vivir en Costa Rica y aqui tuvo sus hijos. Se vino de allá buscando mejorar las condiciones de vida junto con su madre. Es trabajadora y busca siempre la superación. Tiene como meta crecer en su actividad económica para ayudar en su hogar, debido a que el trabajo de su esposo es ocasional en las bananeras o piñeras, las cuales son la mayor fuente de empleo de ésta comunidad rural. Escogieron éste nombre porque se sienten identificadas y seguras. Éste es el segundo crédito que solicita para reforzar su actividad productiva, el cual va invertir en comprar terneros y pollos. Junto con Yansi trabajan tres socias más, que van invertir en el sector pecuario como es la cria de cerdos y pollos para la venta. Todas buscan el mismo objetivo generar ingresos para superarse a nivel personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Yansi is 34 years old, she is married and has three children.

She comes from Nicaragua, but she has lived in Costa Rica for many years, she had her children there and now she is a naturalized Costa Rican citizen. She left Nicaragua with her mother seeking better living conditions.

She is a hardworking woman and always tries to overcome difficulties and improve herself.

Her goal is to make her business grow so that she can financially help at home. Her husband works in the banana or pineapple plantations, which are the main source of employment in this rural community, but it is not a regular job.

Yansi and the other members of the group chose the name 'Las hijas de Dios' because they identify with it and it makes them feel safe.

This is the second loan she requests to strengthen her business, she will use it to buy cattle and chickens. Yansi works with other three members, who are also going to invest in the livestock sector, fattening pigs and chickens for sale.

They all have the same goal, generating an income to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

loans.use: to buy cattle and chickens

loans.name: Siege De La Sagesse A Group

texts.fr: Chikuru est une commerçante, trésorière du groupe solidaire «Siege de la sagesse A», âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers habillement dans un magasin du centre commercial depuis 18 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter de pagnes, jupes, vestes, pantalons, chemises, sous vêtements, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite achever sa maison qui est en chantier, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Chikuru is a retailer and the treasurer of the "Siege de la sagesse A" solidarity group. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of 8 children who all attend school. She has been selling clothing in a shop located in the commercial district for 18 years. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so that she can grow her business. She plans to buy items of clothing including pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing), skirts, jackets, trousers, shirts and underwear. She would like to finish off her house which is under construction and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. She thanks Hekima for the support it gives to female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, skirts, jackets, trousers, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
Hilarion es un hombre de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años y 1 hija mujer de 3 años, y se dedica a la agricultura. 
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en el ‘Chapare’ un tranquilo pueblo en medio del río y la selva dónde existe un parque dedicado a la recuperación de animales que han sido rescatados. Se llama parque “Machia” y es un refugio para animales maltratados. A esta comunidad llegan extranjeros de todo el mundo, porque caminar en la noche y nadar en el río es una experiencia anti-stress.
Hilarion es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la disfruta junto a su pareja que trabaja en la agricultura y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, la menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, para acceder a agua deben dirigirse al rio que queda a 10 minutos de distancia de caminata. Su trabajo es la agricultura, generalmente siembra fruta exótica como la piña. Las siembras se cuidan cortando la maleza diariamente ya que el descuido haría que la selva tapara la siembra. “me traslade a vivir al campo porque el cuidado de la siembra se realiza a diario, la cosecha se vende entera y quisiera darle a mi familia agua potable…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la venta se realiza por mayor, la desventaja son las inclemencias del tiempo. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para su familia no tenga que tomar agua sucia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con las institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Hilarion solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para su familia no tenga que tomar agua sucia.
texts.en:
Hilarion is a 25-year-old man, who lives with his partner, he has one 6-year-old son and a 3-year-old daughter, and he works in agriculture. 

He is a good father, enterprising, independent, dependable, patient, responsible and hard-working. His worked is located in Chapare, a peaceful village between the river and the jungle where there is a park dedicated to the recuperation of rescued animals. The park is called Machia and is a refuge for mistreated animals. Foreigners from all over the world come to this community because walking at night and swimming in the river is an anti-stress experience. 

Hilarion has dark skin, dark eyes, short black hair, is short, has a medium physique, his native language is Quechua which he speaks in this place and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work he does. He enjoys life with his partner, who works in agriculture, and with their children. The older one goes to school, the younger one isn't school age yet. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting which has electricity. To get water, they have to go to the river which is 10 minutes away by foot. His work is agriculture, generally he grows exotic fruit like pineapple. He cares for the crops, cutting the weeds daily since neglect would let the jungle take over the crops. "I moved to live in the country because one cares for the crop daily, the harvest is sold as a whole and I wanted to give my family potable water..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he sells his product in bulk, the disadvantage is inclement weather. His dream is to finish building his house. He wants to hook up potable water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry so his family doesn't have to drink dirty water. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that he has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Hilarion asks for a loan to connect drinking water to his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry so his family doesn't have to drink dirty water.

loans.use: for the connection of drinking water to the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry so his family doesn't have to drink dirty water.

loans.name: Jose Erbin

texts.es: Jose de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una panadería donde elabora pan francés y pan dulce, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, jaleas de sabores, azúcar, moldes, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose, 35 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has a bakery where he bakes French bread and sweet breads. His business has been located in his home for the past 10 years. He has many customers, especially his neighbors, for the quality with which he makes the bread. With the sales that he makes, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase flour, flavored jellies, sugar, molds, etc. to continue with his work and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase flour, flavored jellies, sugar, molds, etc.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. 

She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. She has opened in her house a room to prepare homemade foods for the past seven years and has gained a fair number of customers so far. 

Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments… in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. 

In the future, she plans to open her own store.
