loans.use: to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old. She is married with 2 children who are 2 and 8 years old, one of whom goes to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 20 years. Also her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay medical insurance and to improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Etbel Jeannette

texts.es: Etbel de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene 21 años de tener su negocio el cual le genera buenas ganancias, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Etbel, 45 years old, lives in her own house with her two children and her husband. She has a small store located in her home. She has had this business for 21 years, which generates good earnings, she has many customers, especially her neighbors. With the sales she makes, she manages to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, etc. and in this way be able to have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Patricio

texts.es: Edwin es un joven soltero de 29 años de edad, él vive con su abuelito, su madre  que  trabaja de empleada doméstica y  sus  5 hermanos de los cuales 1 asiste a la universidad y 3 asisten al colegio, Edwin es un joven trabajador que se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crianza de ganado, animales menores y trabaja en cabinas telefónicas, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar terneros, ya que con este negocio él puede ayudarle a su madre con los gastos diarios, Edwin espera apoyar a su madre en los gastos del hogar para que ella les de los estudios a sus hermanos,  Edwin aspira ampliar su negocio y salir adelante juntamente con su familia.
texts.en: Edwin is a single young man, 29 years old, who lives with his grandfather, his mother who works as a domestic employee, and his 5 siblings, of whom one is a university student and 3 are in school. Edwin is a hard-working young man who has worked for 3 years raising cattle, small animals and also works in telephone booths. With the money from the loan, he will purchase calves, since with this business he can help his mother with the daily expenses. Edwin hopes to support his mother with the household expenses so that she can provide education for his siblings. Edwin aspires to expand his business and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta 7º grado, pues fue hasta ahí donde sus padres pudieron apoyarlo, está casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, tiene 3 hijos, 2 estudian en la escuela y el mayor está en bachillerato.

Desde muy joven, Miguel ha trabajado en la agricultura, hoy en día cultiva 2 hectáreas de maíz esto lo hace en época de invierno, el lugar donde trabaja está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y se va a pie porque en el lugar no hay un medio de transporte, pero antes de eso tiene que ordeñar las vacas y llevarlas al pasto, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos del hogar vendiendo pupusas y antojitos.

Él solicita este préstamo a Credicampo para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultiva y para preparar la tierra.

Sus sueños son sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles, estudios, además quiere comprar más vacas.
texts.en: Miguel is 47 years old. He studied up to 7th grade, because it was up to then when his parents were able to support him. He is married and his wife works in commerce. He has 3 children: two go to school and the oldest one to high school. Since he was very young, Miguel has worked in agriculture. Nowadays, he grows 2 hectares of corn. He does this during the winter. His place of work is located 1 kilometer from his home, and he walks there because there is no transportation. Before that, he has to milk the cows and take them to the fields. His wife helps him with household expenses by selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and snacks. He is requesting this loan to Credicampo to pay for the rental of the land where he farms, and to prepare the soil. His dreams are to move his children ahead, to give them an education, and also to buy more cows.

loans.use: to pay for the rental of the land where he farms, and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.en:
Gualberto is 42 years old. He is married and he has two children. Gualberto has his own house and he is a farmer.

Gualberto and his wife (Simeona) make cheese. They wake up at 5:30 a.m. Gualberto needs a loan to buy a new milking cow. In that way he will be able to produce more milk and to sell more cheese. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a new milking cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more men's and women's clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y sus tres hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, desde hace 2 años , tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, café, azúcar, leche, etc. todo por mayor, y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Rosa, 36 years old, lives in her own house with her mother and her three children. She has had a store located in her home for the past 2 years. She has many customers, especially her neighbors. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase soups, basic grains, coffee, sugar, milk, etc., all in bulk, and in this way be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase soups, basic grains, coffee, sugar, milk, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Irma Del Carmen

texts.es: Irma de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual le genera buenos ingresos para solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pescados por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Irma is 38 years old and lives in a privately owned house with her husband. She has been making a living selling fish for three years. She sells as a street vendor in the different areas near to her house and earns good profits that she uses to cover some household costs. Irma is applying for a loan in order to buy more fish in bulk. She can then continue with her sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fish in bullk.

loans.name: Jorge Geovani

texts.es: Jorge de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos de pesca como trasmayos y la reparación del motor de la lancha que es el que muestra en la fotografía ay asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is 50 years old and lives in a privately owned house with his wife and two children. He has been making a living as an independent fisherman for 20 years and sells his products in the area surrounding his home. He is able to use his profits to cover some household costs. Jorge is applying for a loan in order to buy more items for fishing, such as nets, and to repair the engine on his boat, which is shown in the photograph. With this loan, Jorge can continue with his sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy nets and repair the engine of his boat.

loans.name: Thasienne

texts.en:
Thasienne is aged 56 years. She is married and has five children aged between 7 and 26 years. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 30 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Erika Santana

texts.es:
Erika de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, no pudo continuar en la universidad por su situación económica, está casada y tiene una niña de 5 años de edad y que ya estudia kínder.

Erika ya tiene cinco años de trabajar en una tienda de celulares, ya que es una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones y es  por ello que tiene bastante tiempo en dicho trabajo, además vende tostadas los fines de semana.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar materiales para el techo de su casa y comprar insumos para la venta de tostadas.

Ella sueña con tener una casa amueblada, que su hija siga estudiando y poner una pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Erika, 26 years old, completed her secondary school education. She couldn't go to university because of her economic situation. She is married and has a 5 year old daughter who is already in kindergarten. 

Erika has been working for five years in a cell phone store; she is is a very responsible person with her obligations and for this reason she has been in this job for so long. In addition, she sells tostadas on the weekends. 

The loan will be used to purchase materials for the roof of her house and to purchase supplies for the tostada sales. 

She dreams of having a furnished house, of her daughter continuing her schooling, and of opening a small store.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the roof of her house and to purchase supplies to sell tostadas.

loans.name: Inelda Marbely

texts.es:
La Señora Inelda de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijas las cuales estudian y dependen de ella y habita en la comunidad de Arenales Trojes al oriente de Honduras,  y se dedica al destazo de Cerdos desde hace 5 años, con esta actividad ella satisface sus necesidades, y ella vende su productos a vecinos y amigos de la comunidad los cuales le prefieren por su calidad de productos.
Doña Inelda está solicitando el préstamo para comprar cerdos y seguir satisfaciendo sus necesidades básicas ya que con esta actividad ella obtiene sus ingresos.
Doña Inelda su sueño es hacer profesionales a sus hijas para que tengan un mejor futuro y sean personas preparadas en la vida.

Trojes, Honduras – Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Inelda, 35 years old, is a single mother who has 2 daughters who are students and depend on her and she lives in the community of Arenales Rojes in the eastern part of Honduras. She has worked butchering pigs for the past 5 years. With this work, she satisfies her needs and she sells her products to her neighbors and friends in the community who prefer her for her quality products.

Inelda is asking for the loan to purchase pigs and continue satisfying her basic needs since with this work she gets her income.

Inelda's dream is to make her daughters into professionals so they have a better future and are people prepared for life.  

Trojes, Honduras – March 2015

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her business.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo de 22 años de edad, es el propietario de un restaurante y necesita  aumentar sus compras de materias primas, con los cuales obtener descuentos y aumentar su competitividad en el mercado.  Todo esto porque necesita ganar más, para hacer mejoras locativas, que optimicen el funcionamiento de su negocio  y más adelante, poder  comprar su propia vivienda. Jairo inició su restaurante hace más de un año, tiempo en el cual se ha dedicado de manera persistente a trabajar,  para poder avanzar en sus propósitos de prosperidad, y al que ha agregado una oferta de comidas rápidas, que son muy apetecidas en el sector. Él desde muy joven trabajó en un restaurante de lunes hasta los domingos y desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 e la noche. Sus ventas las realiza de contado a sus clientes, que son habitantes del sector y que cada vez más, se incrementan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos materias primas para incrementar la diversidad de comidas rápidas y elaborar diversos menús, que dará satisfacción a   su clientela en su necesidad de consumir deliciosos y nutritivos productos hechos con el sabor que Jairo sabe dar, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jairo, 22 years old, is the owner of a restaurant and he needs to expand his purchases of raw materials, with which to get discounts and expand his competitiveness in the market. All of this is because he needs to earn more, to make improvements to the site, which will optimize the functioning of his business, and later, to be able to purchase his own house. Jairo began his restaurant over a year ago, time in which he has worked persistently to be able to advance in his goal of prosperity and to which he has added sales of fast food, which are very popular in the sector. Since he was very young, he worked in a restaurant from Monday to Sunday, from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. 

He sells in cash to his customers, who are inhabitants of the sector and each day they increase. Currently, he is asking for a Kiva loan, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase raw materials to increase the diversity of fast foods and make more diverse menus, which will give his customers satisfaction in their need to eat delicious and nutritious foods made with the flavor Jairo knows how to provide, in this way making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as groceries, sauces, dressings, etc.

loans.name: María Lucresia

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la pesca artesanal y agricultura, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y han formado sus propios hogares.

María desde pequeña se ha dedicado al comercio de pescados, esto lo aprendió de su madre, y lo sigue haciendo hoy en día para ayudar a su esposo, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar los alimentos y salir a trabajar.

Este préstamo lo solicita para comprar una lancha para que su esposo pueda trabajar mejor en la pesca.

Ella planea seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y además reparar poco a poco su casa ya que está dañada.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, she went to school up to the 8th grade, is married, and her husband works in traditional fishing and agriculture. All their children are adults and have made their own homes.

María, since she was little, has worked selling fish, which she learned from her mother, and she continues doing so today to help her husband. She gets up very early to make the food and to go out to work.

She asks for this loan to purchase a boat so her husband can work better at fishing. 

She plans to continue supporting her husband with the household expenses and in addition, to repair her house little by little since it is damaged.

loans.use: to purchase a boat so that her husband can work better at fishing.

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan tiene 59 años de edad, es padre de 10 hijos, estudió hasta  tercer grado, comenta que  por la situación económica que pasaba su familia no logró seguir estudiando, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar, actualmente en su vivienda viven 6 personas, los 4 hijos que viven con él se encuentran estudiando pues los mayores ya se acompañaron.


 Juan se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra granos básicos como maíz y frijol, además cuida de sus vacas que le proporcionan leche para la alimentación de su familia, el lugar donde trabaja está a 2 kilómetros de su casa y se va a pie, sus hijos y su esposa le ayudan en los trabajos que realiza.

 Este crédito lo necesita para pagar mano de obra, comprar abono y fertilizantes para los cultivos de maíz, frijol y maicillo.


Él espera obtener  mayor  producción de granos básicos y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para sus hijos, que sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
texts.en: Juan is 59 years old. He has 10 children. He studied up to third grade. He states that because of his family's financial situation, he was not able to keep on studying. His wife works in household chores. Currently, 6 people live in his house: 4 of the children who live with him are studying, because the oldest ones live with their spouses. Juan works in agriculture. He grows basic grains such as corn and bean. He also takes care of his cows which provide milk to feed his family. His place of work is located 2 kilometers from his house, and he walks there. His wife and children help him with his work. He needs this loan to pay for hand labor, to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn, bean and sorghum crops. He hopes to get more production of basic grains and to live comfortably in a place which is worthy for his children, and for them to keep on studying and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for hand labor and to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn, bean and sorghum crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land growing corn and beans, to pay for labor, and to buy soil amendments and fertilizer

loans.name: Jamin's Group

texts.en:
Jamin, featured in the above picture, is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 74 years old and a married father of nine children, often described as a very experienced farmer. 

Although Jamin has been a farmer for more than 50 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though he is new to the program, Jamin wanted to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Jamin hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive nine solar lights among them and farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, ella tiene 33 años vive en una comunidad de Sololá junto a su linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre  1 y 14 años.
Para Estela no hay nada más importante que su familia, es por ello que para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica desde hace cinco años a la compra y venta de artesanías de baro como jarrones,  floreros  entre otros.
Estela una gran señora que su mayor propósito es poder hacer de su negocio una tienda de artesanía, pues hasta ahora ella lo tiene  en su casa pero en una lugar no muy indicado y poco vistoso por lo que ella ahora solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en su tienda de artesanía comprando jarrones de barro, floreros, molinos de piedra.
Estela sueña con poder conseguir el crédito para poder realizar su inversión y mejorar sus ganancias para poder  tener su local de artesanía.
texts.en:
Estela is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is 33 years old and lives in a community in Sololá with her lovely family, comprising four children with ages ranging from one to fourteen years old.

There is nothing more important for Estela than her family. She therefore earns her own living in order to support them. For five years she has worked buying and selling handicraft goods made with mud, including vases and flowerpots.

Estela is a great woman whose main aim is to turn her business into a handicrafts shop. She currently runs the business out of her home but it is not very obvious to passers-by. She is therefore applying for a loan to invest in her handicrafts business by buying mud vases, flowerpots, and stone mills.

Estla dreams of taking out this loan in order to invest in her business and earn higher profits. She will then be able to own her own premises.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts, including mud vases, flowerpots, and stone mills.

loans.name: Naziha

texts.en:
Naziha is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Lebanon. Her husband is the main income provider in the family; he owns a grocery store. 

In order to supplement the family’s income and to help her husband, Naziha started her own work as a farmer, which she has been doing for two years. Her job consists of cultivating fruits and vegetables, which she uses to prepare homemade foods. 

Naziha requested a loan from Vitas s.a.l., which she will use to purchase seeds and additional food provisions. The loan will help her increase her business productivity by a fair percentage which will return higher profits to her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Ana Ester

texts.es: Ana vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos (queso, crema, requesón quesillo, etc.) tiene 4 años de tener el negocio el cual está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, y posee muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de leche por mayor para la producción y asi seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own house with her three children and her husband.  She sells dairy products (cheese, cream, cottage cheese, and soft cheese, etc.).  She has had the business for four years, and it is located at her house.  She has a lot of customers because of the good prices.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk wholesale for the production.  This way she will continue with her sales, which generate good earnings for her.

loans.use: to buy milk wholesale.

loans.name: Giribati

texts.en:
Giribati is aged 34 years and married with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. To supplement his income, he operates a bar, and all his businesses have seen him look after his family very well. He meets hardships of the price changes of produce products, which affects his income projections. 

His future plan is to expand his business into new market areas. He is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Patrick, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 41 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and has two children.

Patrick is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Patrick says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. He is purchasing a solar light this year which he is so excited about as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel therefore allowing him to save more money. Patrick will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase two solar lights, seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is single with no child. He does cattle trading as his major source of income. He has applied for a loan of UGX 3,500,000 (Three million five hundred thousand shillings) to buy cows for selling.  

He started business in the year 2009 with high hopes of earning income to start up other businesses. He also does agriculture to supplement his monthly income. His business is located in his local cell of residence Nyambira 2, Burere, Kashenshero Mitooma District and his clients are all categories of people, especially those around his area. 

He is a hardworking man who works 10 hours a day and is faced with a challenge of high prices for cows but is determined to grow his business through his hard work. He hopes to become financially stable and start up more businesses in future. He requests UGAFODE MDI to continue supporting their businesses with loans.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cheese, cream, and other staple products for her store

loans.name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Taw Ka Yan Lay Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of 25 villagers, overseen by five CBO (community based organization) members.

A loan will enable some of the group members to purchase crop inputs such as seeds and fertilizers for their farms. The funds will help other group members pay for daily workers to help perform work duties on the farm, including cultivation, monitoring, and harvesting.
 
Taw Ka Yan Lay Village has a population of over 800. Farming rice paddy is the main focus of the village. Most villagers either farm their land or are hired labor for those with land. In addition to rice, some households plant seasonal food and raise livestock such as ducks for additional income and pigs for savings.

Pictured above are CBO members from Taw Ka Yan Lay Group 2, named Hla, Tout, Aye, Amar and Tin. 

Hla is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He farms on his five-acre crop farm where he plants rice and seasonal vegetables. For additional income, Hla's family also sell groceries from their house. Hla wants his children to finish higher schools so that they receive a good education. Like his fellow members, his loan will help him purchase fertilizers and pay for hired labor.

loans.use: to help purchase crop fertilizers and pay for farming labor costs.

borrowers.first_name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 2

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old. He is single and he doesn't have children but he takes care of his parents. He lives with them. He is the only person that makes money at his home. 

Luis works as a driver and he works a lot of hours. He needs a loan to buy an engine for his minibus because he needs it very much.  

Luis appears in the picture with his minibus.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his minibus.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 43-year-old single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She is the main income provider in her family. She has been working since three years ago at her house selling homemade foods and working also in parallel as a housekeeper in a local hospital with the aim to help her family to meet the needs of life. 

Fadia is asking a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business merchandise to give the best product to her clients in order to develop her work and her income. She is very sure that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes that in the future, she might open her own store.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise.

loans.name: Adrine

texts.en:
Adrine is a married woman of 28 years with four dependents living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a drug shop in the rural area, a business she ventured in to serve the local community, who were moving long distances to access health services. She has a desire of buying a car to ease her movements and reach out to her clients quickly. In spite of this, she meets a difficulty of bad debtors that hinder her business growth.

Adrine has asked for a loan to stock human drugs like aspirins and other drugs to sell.

loans.use: to stock human drugs like aspirins and other drugs to sell.

loans.name: Parkleuang Group

texts.en:
Poun is excited the TerraClear water filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Poun and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Poun and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years.  

Poun and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Poun and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Fadai Group

texts.en:
Chongvue’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Chongvue and his group are excited that the Terra Clear filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Chongvue and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years of filter use, users like Chongvue’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonxai Group

texts.en:
Lea understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Lea knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Lea purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.   

Lea is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years — so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kheanyong Group

texts.en:
On is excited the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan. On and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  

The water filter On and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years. On and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, On and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a young man who is aged 36 years old with two children and two dependents from his late brother who died four years ago. All his children and dependents are in school and depending on him for survival.  Because of such a family and responsibilities, he resorted to serious cattle fattening and milk production in a month, supplying nearby trading centers and Mbarara town. This activity has made him capable of paying school fees for his children and looking after the whole family. 

He appreciates the Kiva partnership and their commitment toward fighting poverty. He will use the money to buy baby cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy baby cows for fattening

loans.name: Gabriel Yovanny

texts.es:
Gabriel es un hombre de 28 años de edad, muy trabajador, emprendedor que trabajo gran parte de su adolescencia en las labores de la construcción, pero solo en el año 2008 decidió independizarse y buscar sus propios caminos.
En el camino ha habido dificultades pero piensa que tomo la mejor decisión ya que gracias a esto es un hombre más feliz, más ordenado, mas responsable, sus condiciones en su hogar mejoran, nacieron sus dos hijas que tienen un y dos años de edad y trabajara más duro y constante para darles una excelente calidad de vida y oportunidades para buscar un mejor futuro.
Se desempeña como oficial de obra, realiza reparaciones, construcciones, pisos, enchapes, baños, casas, se le mide a cualquier negocio, pero presenta una dificultad, su mayor campo de acción son las veredas y el transporte realmente es muy dificultoso, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta para desplazarse entre las veredas a realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Gabriel, age 28, is very hard-working and enterprising.  During most of his adolescence he did construction work.  However, in the year 2008 he decided to become independent and go his own way.

On the way he has had difficulties, but he thinks he made the best decision.  Thanks to this he is a happier man, more organized, and more responsible.  His living conditions are better.  His two daughters, ages one and two, were born.  He will work harder and more steadily in order to give them an excellent quality of life and opportunities to seek a better future.

He is a work official.  He works on repairs, construction, floors, veneers, bathrooms, and houses.  He is open to any task.  However, he has a difficulty.  Most of his work is in rural areas, and transportation is very difficult.

Therefore, he wants to request a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to travel to the rural areas to do his work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to his jobs.

loans.name: Phonthong Group

texts.en:
Nu’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Nu and her group are excited that the water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Nu and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Nu’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

Boudthiyodthilath is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

Dao understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Dao knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Dao purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Dao is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Darwin Esneider

texts.es:
Darwin es una persona alegre, muy trabajadora, constante y perseverante, tiene 28 años de edad, no tiene hijos su única ambición es remendarle a sus padres todo lo que han hecho por él. 
Se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes, tiene un puesto de venta rodante y se caracteriza porque siempre ofrece un servicio amigable y sus bebidas son frescas pues las prepara apenas compras una.
Trabaja diariamente 8 horas, recorre varios barrios hasta llegar al centro de la ciudad donde genera sus mayores ventas.
Su sueño es tener sostenibilidad, en un futuro poder tener otro carro y empezar a emplear personas.
Solicita un préstamo que quiere convertir en el motor para sus sueños, dicho capital lo invertirá en la unos arreglos que necesita su puesto de bebidas y el resto de capital lo destinara todo en la compra de variedad de frutas para preparar sus ricos jugos.
texts.en:
Darwin is a very happy hard-working, consistent and preserving person. He is 28 years old and has no children. His only ambition is to repay all that his parents have done for him.

He works selling refreshing drinks. He has a mobile sales stand and he is known to always offer friendly service and his drinks are fresh as he prepares them when you buy one. He works 8 hours a day traveling through a number of neighborhoods until he gets to the center of the city where he makes his best sales.

His dream is to be sustainable and in the future have another cart and start to employ other people. He is requesting a loan that he wants to convert into the driving force for his dreams. He will invest this capital in undertaking some repairs that his cart needs and the rest of the money will be used buying a variety of fruit to prepare his delicious juices.

loans.use: to repair his drink cart and buy fruit and disposable glasses.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара, 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Дети активно помогают матери. В хозяйстве Гулсары на сегодняшний день есть  корова и 20 овец, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,67 ГА, она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход Гулсары составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Гулсары и ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulsara is 47 years old, married and has three children. She has received secondary education. For many years she has been raising livestock and growing farm crops. Her children actively help her. Gulsara now has a cow and 20 sheep on her farm; she also owns a land plot of 1.67 ha [4 acres], where she grows beans. Gulsara’s monthly revenue is 10,000 KGS. 

In order to develop her farm further, Gulsara applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep. The revenues from her business will allow Gulsara to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Buvan

texts.ru: Буван, 59 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей, образование - среднее. Успешно занимаясь животноводством и полеводством, Буван добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 2 коровы и 2 лошади. Также на земельном наделе мерою 1,0 ГА арендованной и 0,92 ГА собственной она выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Буван обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На прибыль от кредита она планирует увеличить своё хозяйство и построить сараи.
texts.en:
Buvan is 59 years old, married and has four children. She has received secondary education. She has been successfully raising livestock and growing farm crops. Buvan has achieved excellent results: at present she owns two cows and two horses. She also grows barley on 1.0 ha [2.5 acres] of leased land and 0.92 ha of own land, for own consumption and sale. Her monthly income is approximately 10,000 KGS. 

In order to develop her business further, Buvan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy livestock. She plans to use her revenue to develop her farm and build new barns.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her headcount

loans.name: Leydi Noemy

texts.es:
Leydi, de 29 años de edad, estudio bachillerato opción contador, está acompañada y es madre de una niña de 3 años de edad, en su casa vive sola con su pareja y su hija.

Leydi, trabaja en una pequeña tienda que tiene desde hace algunos años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad y también recargas de celular.- También, trabaja en una cooperativa de café al igual que su pareja, su lugar de trabajo está a una hora desde su casa y les proporcionan transporte.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar productos para su tienda y surtir con más productos.

El sueño de Leydi, es obtener mejores ganancias en su tienda y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Leydi is 29 years old and completed her secondary schooling, studying accounting. She is married and the mother of a 3 year old daughter. Only her husband and daughter live with her in their house. Leydi works in a small store that she has had for a number of years where she sells basic food items and also cell phone recharging cards. Besides this she works in a coffee cooperative along with her husband. Her place of work is one hour from her house and they provide transport. She needs the loan to buy products for her store to stock it with more items. Leydi's dream is to obtain more profits from her store and be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products for her store and stock up on more products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and get milk to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old, married, and is blessed with 4 children. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops such as maize, vegetables, and napier grass to sell.

She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk production and make more income to pay school fees for her children and also start a dairy milk shop.
 
Her future hopes are to improve her farming business, be successful, and be able to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk production and make more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her increase the number of litres produced per day to supply to her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her increase the amount of milk produced per day to supply to her clients.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 55 years old, married to Mellen, and they are blessed with 4 children. He sells construction materials such as metal doors, windows and iron sheets among other items. He is also a dairy farmer.

He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to enable him get milk to sell and make more income. He will use the generated profits to add more metal and steel materials for making windows and doors for sale to his clients. 

His future hopes are to expand his business and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him get milk for sell and make more income to add more construction supplies.

loans.name: Las Tres Rosas Group

texts.en:
Maria, a 51-year-old member of the Trust Bank, married quite young and has seven children. She was not able to attend school. Maria is very happy and grateful that she is affiliated with KIVA and Friendship Bridge. She secured her first loan last May that she used to buy pigs, cows and horses. Maria is requesting a second loan that she will invest in additional chickens and pigs. She will also use some of the funds to buy thread and materials for her textile business. Maria makes the beautiful traditional blouses of the area called “huipiles” that are proudly worn and highly prized by the women in the area. 

The community of Chupoj is located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala outside the town of Chichicastenango. The area is characterized by lush vegetation and hard-working people. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Tres Rosas” or “The Three Roses” is located here. The ladies in the Trust Bank range from 26 to 51 years of age. They aspire to improve themselves, raise their standard of living and make a positive impact in their community. The women are most appreciative that KIVA investors funded their previous loan last May and are pleased to report that the loan was paid back in full and on time. Their businesses were greatly aided by the funds. The women are requesting a new loan that they hope will be funded by KIVA investors.

Maria and her friends in the Trust Bank are most appreciative to KIVA investors for funding their loans. We look forward to providing a follow-up report soon so that KIVA investors can track the progress of the group!

loans.use: to buy additional chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk production for selling the milk, and he hopes this will enable him buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alidrije

texts.en:
Alidrije, a 32-year-old woman, wants to open up a hair salon in a little town where she currently lives with her retiree father and her sister who works as kitchen help in a nearby restaurant. 

Before moving to the town, she lived in a village until her mother passed way accidentally; Aldrije grieved for a very long time. She then moved to the town and started working as a part-time elementary school teacher, but considering the fact that there are almost no new openings in her field, she is certain now that it will take years for her to gain full-time employment in her occupation. 

This was the reason why she planned on opening up a hair salon where she could use her hair-cutting skills.

loans.use: to open up a hair salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to increase milk production, meet the high demand of his customers, and get more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has been working in the communications field for over 15 years. She worked for Cox Radio Inc., Reagan National Advertising, and Sinclair Broadcasting, but she then got the idea to venture out on her own as a small business owner. Operating out of San Antonio’s Westside, Veronica created The Social Being: Meetings & Media Firm in 2011. The company is a full service digital marketing and event management firm that helps brand others' businesses, especially small businesses.

The Social Being provides social media marketing plans, website development, search engine optimization, and offers training classes for digital marketing. The Social Being specializes in making social media understandable and accessible to all small business owners since a strong marketing plan provides the means to a healthy business.

Veronica earned a Bachelor of Arts in Communications from the University of Texas at San Antonio. In addition to being the CEO and founder of The Social Being, she teaches web design and development at Sanford Brown College.

She came to LiftFund because she is seeking to expand her business. Currently, she is buying the office space next to hers and combining it with her original space for her growing business and staff. Veronica will also need financial support to buy essential equipment that will help her and her staff deliver quality advertisement tools to small businesses. 

Veronica has hired seven part-time employers to help her develop The Social Being, and she plans to hire more this year. The inter-active company website lists all the services Veronica and her team do for clients.

loans.use: to pay for office space and equipment

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe knew what career she wanted to invest her time in: designing and creating jewelry. She dedicated herself to cultivating and perfecting the art of jewelry-making when she opened Padalia Designs in her own home in Arlington, Texas. 

She enrolled in a jewelry design school in 1990 and uses her experience to fashion modern jewelry pieces for every woman to wear. Guadalupe was inspired to start her own business when she showcased her work to friends and fellow church members. Padalia Designs offers hand-crafted necklaces, earrings and bracelets, and sells purses. 

Word of mouth spread, and clients just kept coming back. Padalia Design is also the only jewelry shop in the area, which drives Guadalupe to ensure excellent customer services. “Running my own business is important to me,” says Guadalupe, “I always complete my clients' orders because as a dedicated business owner, I offer great service and high quality products.” 

Guadalupe’s main focus is to expand her customer base and inventory. Currently, Guadalupe is reaching out to potential clients through Facebook, Twitter, flyers and references from friends. She is determined to accomplish her ideas for increasing sales and profits for her business. 

Guadalupe came to LiftFund to purchase the inventory she needs to support her new marketing ideas. She is also looking into ways to help her business grow and become self-sustainable. Guadalupe has hired one employee and plans to hire another one for Padalia Designs.

loans.use: To pay for inventory

loans.name: Flores De Chontola Group

texts.en:
The community of Chontola is located in a rural area outside of the Western Highland town of Chichicastenango in Guatemala. There are eleven women who live here who have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flores de Chontola” or “Flowers of Chontola”. They share an enthusiastic spirit and an optimistic outlook. The majority of them work in traditional textile production.

Herminia is a 39-year-old member of the Trust Bank with eight children. Although she only was able to attend school for a year, she has a lot of drive and vision to empower herself, raise the standard of living for her family, and provide education for her children. Herminia prepares and sells delicious snacks during the week, delivering them to the homes of her customers. She also has an orchard where she grows apples and peaches and sells her fruit in her community on market days. Herminia is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase ingredients and supplies for her snacks as well as insecticides and other materials for her orchard.

It is impossible for a woman like Herminia to walk into a Bank in her area to secure a loan. There is no where for her to gain new skills and information. The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge (loans+education) helps her and the members of the Trust Bank step into a new world as empowered and more educated women and mothers. Thank you KIVA investors for funding these much needed loans!

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and supplies for her snacks as well as insecticides and other materials for her orchard

loans.name: Flor De Aguacate Group

texts.en:
Cristina is the 27-year-old President of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Aguacate” or “Avocado Flower”.  The Trust Bank, made up of eight women, is located in a rural area of Chichicastenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The ladies are involved in various commercial enterprises including traditional textile production and fruit (apples, peaches, plums) production and sales. They sell both inside and outside of their community. The women have increased their income and have invested additional funds to expand their businesses, add an additional business, or been able to meet the financial obligations in their families. Sometimes, they are able to realize all three goals.

Cristina is a hard-working businesswoman who has a textile business. She creates various traditional garments like “huipiles” or beautiful emboidered/woven women’s blouses and shawls that she sells in the large market of Chichicastenango. Cristina has requested a loan that she will use to purchase three kinds of thread and other supplies for her business. Her short-term goal is to earn enough to pay back the loan and request an additional loan, create more textiles that are even finer and of higher quality, and attract more customers. 

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines education and loans, is truly effective for the women. Each month at their meetings, a Loan Officer from the organization shares beneficial information with the ladies, many of whom have had little or no education. Some of the topics covered include nutrition, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants as well as self-esteem, empowerment and goals/dreams. The women also learn about effective business practices.

KIVA investors are valuable and much-appreciated in funding loans for these women. The ladies are poised to step into a brighter tomorrow, benefiting themselves, their families, and their community in rural Chichicastenango.

loans.use: To purchase three kinds of thread and other supplies for her textile business

loans.name: Nhóm 02 - Thôn Thuận17 - Xã Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hữu operates a food stall/restaurant selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to sell. Hữu is 37 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 - Thôn Thuận17 - xã Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members.  Hữu lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hữu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Hữu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hữu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply with hopes this will enable her to generate more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase solar kits to supply and empower rural communities who are without energy access.

loans.name: Saparbubu

texts.ru: Сапарбубу, 46 лет, замужем. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS), в хороший сезон бывает и больше. Сапарбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она будет откладывать на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Saparbubu is 46 and married. She works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family. She currently has five cows and 10 sheep on her farm with a monthly income of about 15,000 KGS, more in a good season.

Saparbubu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She intends to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Meilkan

texts.ru: Меилкан, 41 год, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 10 лет занимается земледелием и животноводством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 10,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Меилкан есть земельный участок мерою 7,0 Га, где она выращивает фасоль. Также есть корова, 20 овец. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сомов (KGS). Меилкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит нетель для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Меилкан развить ее деятельность.
texts.en:
Meilkan is 41 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry for 10 years, a business she started with 10,000 KGS. She currently has 7 hectares of land where she grows beans as well as a cow and 20 sheep, with a monthly income of about 10,000 KGS.

Meilkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase a heifer to increase her headcount of livestock. Profits from the loan will allow her to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to sell more milk and use the generated profits to buy farm inputs and increase her agricultural produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and increase her milk supply to meet the demand of her customers and get more income.

loans.name: Sreymach

texts.en:
Sreymach is a 45-year-old, widowed grocer with five children, who lives in a village in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia.  She has been doing the business at a market for over nine years. Three of her children attend school and one of them is a factory worker. Sreymach and her child can make approximately USD 15 per day. 

Sreymach would like to request a loan because she needs finances to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy more groceries and improve her business. In the future, she is going to build a small grocery store at home, save money to build a proper house, and support her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 - Thôn Thuận 17 - Xã Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sâm operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. Sâm is 35 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 - Thôn Thuận 17 - Xã Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members.  Sâm lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Sâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Sâm has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that She faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Sâm hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 19 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Xã Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to sell. Hoa is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 19 - Thôn Tiến 27 - xã Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of five members. Hoa lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 18 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Xã Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. Hoa is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 18 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Xã Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2015, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tành

texts.en:
Tành is 61 years old, married, and has one child. He lives and works in Bim Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. He operates a manufacturing business making wood furniture, which he has been doing for five years. The main hardship that Tành faces is not having a hygenic latrine. 

Tành is requesting his first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, which he will use to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet. Tành hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet

loans.name: Thường

texts.en:
Mrs Thường has a manufacturing business making firewood. She has been involved in this business for five years. Thường is 41 years old and she is married with three children. This is Thường's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thường lives in Bim Son district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her hygienic latrine is in bad condition. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to repair this toilet.

In the future, Thường hopes  her children are healthy and happy, to build a new house, and that her business is good.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to repair her toilet.

loans.name: Lộc

texts.en:
Mr Lộc works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. He is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He and his business are located in Bim Son district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main harship that Lộc faces in his life is not having a Biogas system. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a Biogas system.

With his business profit, Lộc hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for his children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a Biogas system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to supply milk and get more income to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer and also open a retail shop

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies that are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 36,000 PHP. This new loan will go to purchase additional grocery items, toiletries, and beverages she needs in her store. This assistance will also help her provide for the needs of her family.

Remy wants her business to thrive more, for she desires to save enough for their dream house. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
Ma. Nena is 50 years old and married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Ma. Nena has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, diapers and other groceries. She has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, diapers and other groceries.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia de 51 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortas de carne y jamón, desde hace 15 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, Sonia solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, jamón, carne, entre otros ingredientes y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en: Sonia is 51 years sold and lives in her own house with her family. She has had a business selling meat and ham sandwiches for 15 years. She has a good number of clients as she sells at a good price. She covers some of the household expenses with the profits she makes. Sonia is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy all the is needed to make her sandwiches such as: bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, ham, meat amongst other ingredients. Then she will be able to have greater profit and continue to help support her household with the expenses that occur.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, ham, meat amongst other ingredients.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for organic fertilizers to improve her pineapple farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another Php 50,000 loan which she will use to buy more organic fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive harvest on her farm.  It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and for children’s education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Marcela dreams for her farm to grow and flourish and to have happy and prosperous life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed for her pineapple farm.

loans.name: Hoan

texts.en:
Mrs Hoan works in agriculture farming food. Hoan has been involved in this business for two years. Hoan is 29 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hoan faces in her life is not having Bigodigester system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a Biogas system.

In future, Hoan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her child, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a Biogas system

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is thankful that she was previously granted a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts and maintenance of her vehicle for transport services. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney. It is very important that her jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her two elementary children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help.

Gina aims to buy another jeepney to grow her income. She wants her children to have a college education and find good jobs someday. She prays always for safety of her husband and passengers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney unit.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and supplies, as well as pay for the maintenance of her computer units. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

Alma is very positive that she would be able to improve her business even more if she were able to take another loan of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards the purchase of supplies she needs for her shop as well as pay the maintenance costs of the computer units. Simultaneously, she will be able to continue sustaining her family's needs with help from this assistance.

Alma hopes to grow and expand soon. She desires to have a better life and a stable source of income to support the needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

In the future, Elizabeth wants to see her ukay-ukay business thrive to improve the general living conditions of her family. She hopes to find a bigger space for her shop and she also dreams that all her children will finish their studies.

Norma hopes to have business expansion soon. She also wants to help save for their dream house. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.name: Aquilino De Jesús

texts.es:
Aquilino de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a comercializar medicamentos en una pequeña farmacia, tiene 2 hijas de 17 y 18 años que estudian bachillerato las cuales dependen de él.

Hace 7 años Aquilino participó en un curso de electricista, buscando una alternativa de aprendizaje que le pudiese generar ingresos económicos, esto le permitió empezar a trabajar pequeñas instalaciones, hasta lograr adquirir más experiencia, además en invierno realiza siembra de granos básicos junto a su familia que le sirven para el consumo familiar. 

Él necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar láminas, madera, clavos para reparar el techo de su casa, además comprará medicamentos para seguir vendiendo, el crédito le servirá de mucho pues podrá asegurar su casa para el invierno.

Sus sueños son que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y mejorar su casa pues es de adobe y no son las condiciones adecuadas para su familia.
texts.en:
Aquilino is 43 years old and studied up to Grade 7. He is married and his wife works selling medicine in a small pharmacy. She has two daughters 17 and 18 years old who study at secondary school and are dependent on him.

Seven years ago Aquilino took part in an electrician's course looking for an alternative apprenticeship where he could generate economic income. This allowed him to begin to work on small installations until he could gain more experience. Also in the winter he sows basic grains together with his family which is used for for the family's consumption.

He badly needs this loan to buy laminated sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of his house plus buy medications to continue to sell. The loan will be of great value as it will secure their house for the winter. His dream is for his children to continue their studies and to make improvements on his adobe house as it is not in adequate conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of his house as well as buying medicines to continue selling.

This new loan will buy more raw ingredients and supplies she needs to make more viands and food she sells so she can increase her profit. An increase in profit will also make her business viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Lucia aims to buy their own lot and build their house. She also wants her family's life to be improved and successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, for her food-vending business

texts.fr: Magambo est un commerçant qui s’entraide avec sa femme, vice président d’un collectif de crédits «Siege dela sagesse B», âgé de 44 ans, marié, père de 8 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 2 sont gosses. Il est vendeur des boissons dans un dépôt relais sur la route principale de la ville depuis 16 ans. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va s’approvisionner en bières Simba et sucrées. Ainsi, Il souhaite  construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux   entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Magambo is a small-scale trader who cooperates with his wife. He is vice president of the loan group called «Siege de la sagesse B» (Seat of Wisdom B), aged 44, married and the father of eight children of whom six are in school and two are still young. He has been selling drinks in a post house depot on the main road of the town for 16 years.  

Magambo is asking for a loan from Hekima to grow his business. He is going to stock up on Simba beer and soft drinks. In this way he hopes to be able to build a house, put his children in school, and feed them. He thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are excluded from the established banking system.

loans.use: to stock up on Simba beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 63, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She, together with her family, manages their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leticia owns and oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying a boundary* (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 every day.
				
To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Leticia desires to buy more units of jeepney which she can also use for their transportation business. She aims to save for a new house and lot for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members** to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

The ubiquitous jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines, the Philippines. Interestingly, they were of purely American origins. They were first used by GIs in helping the Filipinos in the fight against the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn a living. The Jeeps were modified into 20-seater jeepneys, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain.

* In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay the maintenance of costs and also buy spare parts and accessories for her jeepney unit.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.
