It is very important that her vehicle always in a good running condition to ensure safe and efficient service. Concepcion hopes to buy another jeepney to expand her transportation business. She would like to give her family a better life.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, tires and registration and for the maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is 26 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Kimberly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Kimberly has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Kimberly aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is 63 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Villa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 2,900 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Villa has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Villa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Pamela Joy

texts.en:
Pamela Joy is 32 years old and married with four children.

Pamela Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Pamela Joy has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Pamela Joy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felly

texts.en: Felly is 49 years old, married and the mother of seven children. Four of her children are in school, and she works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Felly has borrowed and repaid four prior loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns additional income by buying and selling livestock. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a modern farmer who has made her progress through small scale farming and animal rearing. Fatuma thanks UGAFODE for accessing rural areas to partner with underprivileged farmers.

She needs a loan to buy organic fertilizers to help increase her production and income.

Fatuma is committed to paying back her loan well so that she can continue accessing the loan funds. She is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 62 years old, widowed and the mother of three children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for 30 years and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 57 years old. She is married to Bernard, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with six children. She has had a farming business for 27 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, animal feeds, and seeds for use on her farm, and she hopes that this will enable her to increase her farm's production. 

She hopes the anticipated profit will help her to buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, provide medical care, and repay her loan too. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her farming business, secure a larger market for her farm products, provide better education for her children, and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, animal feeds, and seeds, which she hopes will enable her to increase her farm's production.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is grateful that he was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used to buy several sacks of "buco" (young coconut fruit). His earnings helped support his family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from being a dealer of 'buco" he also has a pineapple farm.

He would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan which he will use to buy more fertilizer for a productive pineapple farm. Pineapple fruit is one of the healthiest fruit and among the favorites of Filipinos. He will use part of the loan to buy school office supplies to sell as well. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help and a good return on his investment for it will definitely help cover his family’s daily sustenance.

William aims to sustain and grow his business and then to improve their quality of life and enjoy a long life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and school/office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Maride

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Maride works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Maride is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to resell.

Maride has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 33 years old with six children. With five children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Elma has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like beverages, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Roselyn

texts.en:
Ma. Roselyn is 47 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Roselyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Roselyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Joan works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Joan is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more bundles of firewood to sell.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase office equipment for his real estate business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 45 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María Olga es una mujer de 50 años de edad que se dedica a vender productos de la canasta familiar, como lo son panes, huevos, arroz, panela, aceite de cocina, chocolate, bebidas, quesos, refrescos, víveres, productos de aseo entre otros. 
Ella inicio este negocio por necesidad económica dado que se separó de su esposo y necesitaba una labor que le generara ingresos para su propio sostenimiento y más aun sabiendo que ella no tiene hijos.
Por tal motivo desde el 2001 tiene su negocio y sigue en pie mejorando continuamente para fortalecerse para alimentar sus sueños, comprar vivienda, viajar, conocer monumentos, lugares, templos sagrados entre otros.
Solicita un préstamo el cual quiere invertir para fortalecer ciertas zonas de su tienda que necesitan atención como lo son los granos, licores, y los productos de aseo en general.
Tu préstamo servirá para que esta gran persona siga proyectándose y mejorando y logrando posicionarse más en el mercado y lo más importante aguantar la arremetida de los supermercados.
texts.en:
Maria Olga is a fifty year old woman who works selling general groceries, for example:  bread, eggs, rice, panela, cooking oil, chocolate, drinks, cheeses, sodas, food and hygiene products among others.  She began this business out of economic necessity when she separated from her husband and needed a job that would generate income to support herself, which was important because she does not have children.  For this reason, since 2001 she has had her business and continues to constantly better herself in order to realize her dreams.  She would like to buy a home, travel and see monuments, new places and sacred temples among other sites.  

She is soliciting the loan which she would like to invest in order to strengthen certain parts of her store that need attention, for example:  grains, liquors and general hygiene products.  This loan will enable this wonderful person to continue protecting herself and bettering herself while managing to position herself more in the market.  Most importantly she will withstand the onslaught of the supermarkets.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of general family grocery products to supply her business for two months.

loans.name: Luz Nancy

texts.es:
Luz de 25 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de venta de comestibles.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos golosinas, frituras, galletas, entre otros para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vida sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luz is 25 years old and has won the love of all of her neighbors through her friendliness and good sense of humor. 

She loves her family which is her main drive in struggling each day and generating the support to survive. Although she did not have the resources to start her business, that did not get in the way of her achieving her dream of becoming a business owner. With a little bit of capital, this woman started a small grocery business.  

Her dreams don't stop there, which is why she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of shelving to store her products and make them more visible and attractive to her customers. She will also buy more stock like sweets, fried snacks, cookies, and other things to supply her business.

She hopes to be able to improve her financial situation, have a life free of money worries, and secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shelving to make her products more visible.

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jennilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jennilyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell in her stall for her charcoal business.

Jennilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, soda and instant noodles, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Estella dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education to allow them them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene 30 años de posee ese negocio, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is fifty four years old and lives in her own house with her mother.  She has a small store located in her home.  She has had this business for thirty years.  She has many customers, especially her neighbors.  With the money she obtains from her sales she manages to pay some household expenses.  

She is asking for this loan for the purchase of soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, sweets, pastries, etc.  She will then be have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 49 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for twenty years now.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail is 28 years old. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Abegail runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Abegail has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Abegail would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Shanie Lou

texts.en:
Shanie Lou is married and works hard to support her family. She has an internet café business in the Philippines and also earns income from photography. Shanie Lou is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet café business.

Shanie Lou has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her business

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a married woman who is 43 years old now. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more nail polish and other materials that she needs for her business.

Maricar has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more nail polish and other materials that she needs for her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 32 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as peanuts, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as peanuts, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rimma

texts.ru: Римма, 43 года, замужем, есть 3 детей - школьников, образование у среднее. У Риммы очень хорошие отзывы от соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, на 5,0 Га земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход - в общем около 8,000 сом (KGS). Римма является лидером группы "Умут", всего в группе 3 человека. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Кредит поможет улучшить и развить бизнес.
texts.en:
Rimma is 43 and married with three school-aged children. She has a high school education and is well regarded by her neighbours, who call her a kind and hardworking woman. She works in animal husbandry and agriculture and has three cows and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 5 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. Her monthly income is about 8,000 KGS.

Rimma is leader of the Umut group along with two other people. She has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cows. The loan will help her improve and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase cows in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Umut

texts.ru: Умут, 24 года, замужем, есть 2 детей - дошкольников, образование среднее. Умут занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 3,0 Га земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Умут является участником группы "Умут", всего в группе 3 человека. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей. Кредит поможет улучшить и развить бизнес и накопить на образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Umut is 24 and married with two preschool-aged children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture. She has two cows on her farm as well as 3 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

Umut is a member of the Umut group along with two other people. She has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 65,000 KGS to purchase two heifers. The loan will help her improve and develop her business and save toward her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Shirin

texts.ru: Ширин, 25 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Ширин образование среднее. В качестве дополнительного дохода она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 2,45 Га земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход около 10,000 сом (KGS). Ширин является участником группы "Умут", всего в группе 3 человека. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей. Доходы она направит на  развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shirin is 25 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income. She has two cows on her farm as well as 2.45 hectares of land where she grows beans for sale. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

Shirin is a member of the Umut group along with two other people. She has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 65,000 KGS to purchase two heifers. She will put profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos es un humilde trabajador residente en el municipio de Chigorodo con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es padre de 1 hijo por el cual siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la elaboración y venta de jugos a base de caña de azúcar, estos alimentos los prepara y transporta en una carretilla y los vende de manera ambulante.

Le dedica 9 horas diarias a su negocio.
De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias y el alto costo de las materias primas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materias primas como caña de azúcar, hielo y limón al por mayor para tener una muy buen producción en esta temporada, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a humble, hard-working resident of the city of Chogorodo. His life is filled to the brim with dreams, hopes, and the greatest desires for his family. He is the father of one son, and he's always had the courage and the responsibility to act to make his son's life better.

These days, he makes his living making and selling juices made from sugar cane. He prepares and transports his drinks in a cart that he pushes around town to make his sales. He works this way nine hours a day. The biggest difficulties he faces in his work are the strong rains and the high cost of raw ingredients.

He is requesting this loan to buy raw goods such as sugar cane, ice, and lemons at wholesale. That way, he'll have a good production this season and earn enough money to continue with his business and sustain his family.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making juice at wholesale

loans.name: Mirian Magdalena

texts.es: Mirian de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida su negocio está ubicado en zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, vende a buen precio los platos de comida y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Mirian esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollo, carne, verduras, sopas, vegetales, refrescos, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mirian, age 44, lives in her own house with her mother and her three children. She is in the business of selling food. Her business is located in a busy area, so she has a lot of customers. She sells her plates of food at a good price, and with the money she earns, she is able to meet some of her household expenses.  Mirian is requesting this loan so that she can buy chicken, beef, assorted vegetables and greens, soups, soft drinks, and more at wholesale. This will help her improve her income and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: supply her food stall

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is hardworking, capable, goal-oriented and a kind person. For three years she has worked hard keeping livestock to better her life and living conditions. She wants to see her family happy and works for it.

Matluba is asking for a 15,000 TJS loan from KIVA lenders through IMON International to buy more cattle. She is working to build her business and hopes for support. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en: Ailene is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her hog-raising business and has been in the business for more than 18 years now. This is the source of her income. She also earns an additional income through her fish vending business. Ailene would like to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra has five years of experience doing business in the market. She was born in a remote district and lives in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is divorced and has one child. She is a capable, communicative, honest and kind person. She always tries to be helpful and works hard. Gulchehra has a business buying and selling fruits. She has a place of trading in the centre of the market. She attracts a lot of satisfied clients around her because her fruits are always fresh and tasty. She needs to enlarge her business and live better. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy fruits. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is thankful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 19,000 loan, which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive harvest on her farm.  It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Emelita dreams for her farm to grow and flourish. She wants her children to get a college education and to have happy and prosperous lives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a 64-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari (retail store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Amparo has been in the business for more than 20 years now.

At this time, Amparo would like to take a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods, and others. Amparo believes that a loan will help her to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods, and others

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like sugar, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like sugar, junk foods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mary Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is married and has been raising pigs in the Philippines for the past five years. She also buys and sells vegetables.

Ma. Cristina has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. She is working hard to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina de 23 años de edad, solo estudió hasta bachillerato, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y 4 hermanos.
		 
Reina se dedica a cuidar un niño a una familia, ya tiene 1 año en dicho trabajo, comienza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, luego que sale de trabajar le ayuda a su madre en los oficios del hogar.

Ella solicita este crédito para cubrir  gastos de estudios de su hermana menor y para comprar medicamentos para su madre.

Ella nunca descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando en la Universidad, sacar la carrera de administración de empresas y tener un mejor trabajo, desea también tener su propia casa y formar un hogar.
texts.en:
Reina is twenty three years old.  She studied though high school, is single and lives with her mother and four siblings.  Reina has worked for one year taking care of a child for another family.  She begins at 7:00  am and finishes at 4:00 pm.  She then goes home to help her mother with jobs at home.

She is asking for this loan to cover the cost of her younger sister's studies and to purchase medicine for her mother.  She has never given up the possibility of continuing her studies at the University.  She would like to complete a Business Administration degree and have a better job.  She would also like to have her own house and form a home.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her younger sister's studies and to purchase medicine for her mother.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana Maribel es una mujer de 31 años de edad, está feliz mente casada y tiene una familia de tres hijos de las edades entre cinco y dos años de edad, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ella con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y  venta de zapatos para damas, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace diez años, eligió este negocio porque le deja buenas ganancias.
Para Ana Maribel en esta época que estamos tiene un poco de demanda porque mucha gente busca ahora los zapatos de buena calidad y a un buen precio, por lo que ella ahora necesita surtir mejor su mercadería, pero una de las dificultades que Ana Maribel tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder realizar esta inversión, pero ella es una mujer optimista y ahora ha pensado en solicitar un préstamo para comprar zapatos de tipo pump, peep toes, sandalias, zuecos, bailarinas.
El gran anhelo de Ana Maribel es que su negocio siga prosperando y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana Maribel, age 31, is happily married and has three children between the ages of two and five years old. She and her family live in a community of Sololá. With the goal of earning money to support her family, Ana is in the business of buying and selling ladies' shoes. She's run this business for about ten years, and she chose this field because it provides good income.

For Ana Maribel, there is a little demand at this time of year because many people are looking for good quality shoes at a good price. That's why now is the time for her to stock her business. Her difficulty is that she doesn't have enough capital to make this investment. But she's an optimistic woman and she thought of requesting this loan to buy various kinds of shoes: pumps, peep toes, sandals, ballet flats, and clogs.

Ana Maribel's ultimate goal is that her business continue to prosper, thus enabling her to increase her income.

loans.use: stock her shoe store with the latest styles

loans.name: Nufaika Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 50s is a widow with three kids who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, flours, cooking oil, charcoal, etc. for her food stall. She dreams of taking her kids up to university. 

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, "Nufaika," which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flours, cooking oil, charcoal, etc. for her food stall.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is married and has a one-year-old child. The family lives in Talibon, Bohol, where her husband earns an income as a security guard.

Maricor sells personal products such as soap, body spray, shampoo and toilet bowl cleaner. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through CEVI so she can buy a variety of merchandise to sell to her customers. Her income will be augmented and help her handle her finances more easily.

Maricor’s aim is to expand her business and provide for the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Feninia

texts.en:
Feninia is a 47-year-old mother who was blessed with two children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Feninia makes and sells icing candies within her locality. She aims to further improve this business but she has limited capital.

For this reason, she is requesting an additional loan of PHP 20,000 to buy Peotraco powdered sugar, plastics, sticks, egg white, styrofoams and wires, which are the items needed to make the said icing candies to sell. Having this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy Peotraco powdered sugar, plastics, sticks, egg white, styrofoams and wires

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 50-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. Lydia is engaged in a retail business. She sells various goods and food items to the people in her place. Lydia has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Lydia is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits and other items.  This loan will enable her to improve her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Lydia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits and other items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is grateful that she was granted an 18,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive harvest on her pineapple farm.  It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Nancy dreams for her farm to grow and have her own storehouse. She prays for a happy and prosperous life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies she needs to continue the operation of her farm business.

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is a 36-year-old married woman who is a mother of five children. She has a husband who works as a guard and gets a 400 GEL fixed salary. To make additional income and cover some family-costs, Mzevinar engaged in cattle breeding. She produces milk products that are sold locally. However, this large family requires rather more income to be financially stable and give a good education to the children. Mzevinar needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to start her own stable business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She will open a general store near the house and will serve local people herself.
The loan will greatly assist Mzevinar and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To open a general store and get a stable source of income

loans.name: Amour B Group

texts.fr: Bimuloko est une commerçante, membre de l’association de crédits «Amour B», âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de matelas et cartables à l’entrée de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter dix pièces de matelas et 20 pièces de cartables. Ainsi, elle souhaite achever sa maison qui est en chantier, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes économiquement actives exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Bimuloko is a storekeeper, member of the association of loans “Amour B”, 39 years-old, married, and the mother of 6 children, all schooled. She has been a seller of mattresses and schoolbags at the entrance of the city for 4 years. She asks for this loan with Hekima to increase her activities. She is going to buy ten mattresses and 20 schoolbags. In this way, she hopes to finish her house that is under construction, school and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for bringing help to economically active women excluded from the class banking system.

loans.use: to buy ten mattresses and 20 schoolbags

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 45 years old and he lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Hamlet, in 1997, established his business, which he still manages today. He has a cute café, which over the passing of time, he has made more comfortable and attractive. At this café, customers can have some lunch or dinner (dishes made of fish, pork and poultry) or just coffee with some sweets. Hamlet mentions that all the dishes at his café are made of fresh, tasty and high quality products. Very often people come here to celebrate birthday parties or organize some meetings. This café is situated at the city park. Coming out for a walk in the summer season, Hamlet says, young people visit his café very often and enjoy their time with their friends listening to nice music. Hamlet is married and he has two children.

This man needs a loan because, with the coming of the good season for his café, he wants to refresh the utensils. In particular, he wants to buy new nice cups and plates.

loans.use: to refresh his cafe's utensils, in particular, to buy new, nice cups and plates

loans.name: Sửu

texts.en:
Sửu is 39 years old, married and has three children. For the past ten years she has farmed in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Sửu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, from which she obtained and successfully repaid a loan. She is now applying for a 13,000,000 VND loan to buy sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a Biogas system. These biodigestor systems transform livestock waste into biogas, which can be used for cooking, heating and lighting.

Sửu’s hope is to continue farming successfully, that her children find good jobs and the family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a Biogas system

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 53 years old, married and has five children, the youngest of whom is ten. For the past ten years she has farmed rice to earn a living.

Leonida is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy fertilizers and pesticides. These will help to improve her rice yield and so give her more to sell. With her profits she will be able to provide her family with nutritious meals and better living conditions.

Leonida hopes to continue improving her farm and finance the schooling of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice fields

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena, 43, is married to a driver and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 18 years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase school supplies, food ingredients, grocery items, beverages, and medicines to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies, food ingredients, grocery items, beverages, and medicines to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 39 years old and married with seven children.  With three of her children in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jerico Group

texts.fr: Maroyi est commerçante, membre dela banque villageoise Jerico, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, célibataire, âgée de 23 ans, mère de 1 enfant qui étudie. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires au marché de la ville depuis 1 an. Elle va acheter des oignons, etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir son enfant. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Maroyi is a storekeeper, member of the village bank Jerico, client of the IMF Hekima, singled, 23 years-old, and the mother of 1 child who studies. She began her business with funds received from her parents. She has been a vender of food products in the town market for 1 year. She is going to buy onions, etc. She hopes to obtain more loans, and to school, clothe, and feed her child. In the end, she thanks Hekima pour the support brought to entrepreneurs excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy some onions, etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 33 years old and has three children. Lorna is married and all of her children are in school.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eden Group

texts.fr: Teso est propriétaire d’un cabinet de change de la monnaie dans le centre ville depuis 10 ans, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Eden», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 37 ans, mère de 11 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença avec de fonds de reçu de la tontine. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Elle va acheter la monnaie locale. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Teso has been the owner of a currency exchange practice in the city center for 10 years. She is treasurer of the group of loans “Eden”, client of the IMF Hekima. She is married, 37 years-old, and the mother of 11 children who all go to school. She started with funds received from the savings group.  Her husband is a storekeeper. She is going to buy local currency. She hopes to obtain more loans, to increase her revenue, to school and feed her children. In the end, she thanks Hekima pour the support brought to entrepreneurs excluded from the class banking system.

loans.use: to buy local currency

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
El señor Ruben es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo; construyo los muebles con sus propias manos y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.
 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.

Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Ruben is an experienced carpenter who learned his trade after years of experience working in many carpentry shops. As time went by, he grew more independent, ultimately launching his own shop. In spite of adversity, he has managed to get his family ahead.

His greatest pride is having built a reputation for prestige, thanks to his good work. He builds furniture with his own hands; almost everything you find in his home is a piece he made himself.

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy more wood, make more furniture, and have a great profit margin on his jobs. His primary goal is all about his children: he wants to give them a good education and see them become successful people.  

He thinks of Interactuar as his ally and partner in his production process.

loans.use: buy more wood to make furniture

loans.name: Mạnh

texts.en:
Mạnh is forty years old, married and has two children. For the past ten years she has raised poultry and cattle. The family lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Mạnh took out and successfully repaid a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a 15,000,000 VND loan to buy sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a latrine. Not having one has been a hardship in relation to hygiene for the family.

Mạnh is working steadily to build a new house and see her family healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a latrine.

loans.name: Fakourou's Group

texts.fr: Fakourou,  au deuxième rang à gauche est l'homme sur la photo qui porte le drapeau blanc et la pochette verte myAgro. Il est membre d'un groupe de 14 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Tabou, au sud-ouest de Bamako, au Mali. Fakourou, qui est âgé de 71 ans, vit dans une famille de 18 personnes composée de 11 enfants. Fakourou explique que pour lui l'agriculture est "un moyen de vivre sinon de survivre". Il a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour accéder à un système de paiement innovant ainsi qu'à de nouvelles méthodes agricoles plus productives. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Fakourou a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. A travers cet achat, Fakourou espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir protéger sa famille contre la faim et la famine. Fakourou aimerait aussi pouvoir investir dans l'achat de nouveaux matériels agricoles ainsi que faire construire une nouvelle maison pour l'ensemble de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fakourou, in the second row at left, is the man in the photo holding the white flag and the green envelope myAgro. He is a member of a group of 14 agriculture producers who work and live in the village of Tabou, in the southwest of Bamako, in Mali. Fakourou, who is 71 years old, lives in a family of 18 people, comprising 11 children. 

Fakourou explains that for him farming is “a way of living if not surviving”. He decided to enroll in myAgro in order to access a system of innovative payment as well as the most productive new farming methods. For his first year with myAgro, Fakourou bought a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing corn for his 0.5 hectare plot. Through this purchase, Fakourou hopes to be able to increase his yields in order to be able to protect his family against hunger and famine. Fakourou would also like to be able to invest in the purchase of new agriculture materials as well as build a new house for all of his family.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Lovejoy

texts.en:
Lovejoy is 35 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lovejoy has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items.

Lovejoy has been in this business for two years. In the future,she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio de 36 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad los cuales viven en casa y estudian en la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de él.

Eusebio trabaja en una institución de ayuda a las comunidades de escasos recursos económicos, él es encargado de capacitar en talleres de manuales y vocacionales denominada red solidaria, tiene ya  seis años de trabajar en esta institución,  comenta que entró a trabajar gracias a su deseo de ayudar a las personas en diferentes áreas,  fue así como él tuvo la oportunidad, él no tiene un lugar específico en donde trabajar pues tiene que salir a las comunidades a visitar a las personas y capacitarlos, lo hace de lunes a viernes de 7 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde.

El financiamiento del crédito Eusebio lo utilizará para comprar 48 pliegos de lámina debido a que su techo está deteriorado y en época de lluvia el agua se filtra.

Él planea para un futuro poder ampliar más su vivienda para  tener más espacio con su familia, también no descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria, además desea poder ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 36 years old and managed to complete his secondary studies. He is in a relationship and his partner does housework. He has four children who are minors, study at school and are dependent on him.

Eusebio works in an institution which works with low resource communities. He is in charge of training in manual and vocational workshops, known as a solidarity net. He has been working for 6 years in this institution and he comments that he started this work thanks to his desire to help people in different areas. In this way he had the opportunity but he has no specific place to work so he has to go out to the communities to visit people and train them. He works from Monday to Friday from 7 am until 3 pm.

Eusebio will use the loan to buy 48 sheets of laminate as his roof is deteriorated and in the rainy season water leaks through. His plan for the future is to expand his house to have more space for his family. He is not putting aside the possibility of continuing to study at university and he wants to help his children study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy 48 sheets of laminate sheeting as his roof is deteriorated.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Norqul

texts.ru: Норкул добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 53 лет. Он женат. Со своей семьёй Норкул живут в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Норкул занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуру, а также выращивает лук. Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и там продаёт свой урожай. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Также как дополнительный доход, Норкул имеет от другого вида бизнеса. У него имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает для дальнейшей продажи. Но сейчас Норкул хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Норкул очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Norqul is a kindhearted, hardworking 53-year-old man.  He's married, and lives in a rural village with his family.  To be able to have a source of income for living expenses, Norqul operates his own business.  For 10 years, he's earned his living growing crops and onions as well.  After collecting his harvest, he takes it to a big bazaar and sells it there.  He used to be a dekhan farmer, and later on decided to sell his own harvest.  

Norqul also has an extra source of income from another kind of business.  He has a few heads of livestock which he raises for eventual resale.  But at the moment, Norqul wants to expand his business; namely, his crop-growing business, but currently lacks the money to buy seeds for sowing.  For this reason, he's turned to Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy seeds for sowing.  Norqul is counting on a positive outcome, and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Ayimtilla

texts.ru: Айимтилла, 54 года, замужем, есть 5 детей. Сейчас Айимтилла занимается полеводством на собственном участке мерою 0,30 ГА, где выращивает рис. Свой бизнес она начала 10 лет назад с 10,000 сом. У Айимтиллы также есть 2 коровы и 120 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом. По характеру она человек очень честный, целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Айимтилла обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп 2 коров Доходы от бизнеса Айимтилла собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и улучшение благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Ayimtilla is 54, married, and has 5 children.  Currently, Ayimtilla earns her living growing crops on a 0.30-hectare plot of her own land; specifically, she grows rice.  She started her own business 10 years ago with 10,000 som.  Ayimtilla also has 2 cows and 120 sheep.  Ayimtilla's monthly income is around 15,000 som.  She's very honest, goal-oriented and hardworking in terms of character.  

For the future expansion of her business, Ayimtilla has requested a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy 2 cows.  Ayimtilla is saving her income from her business to further develop her business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get more milk to sell and be able to educate his children.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Phương works in agriculture farming food.

Phương is 53 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Phương hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en: Prescila manages a variety store and a fish pond, does hog raising and has a corn farming business. Her focus this time is on her variety store because her husband is in charge of their corn farming and fish pond businesses. The couple is working hard to get ahead in life. Prescila's four children are settled in marriages. She would like to increase her stock of grocery items but her capital is not sufficient. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will be using this loan to buy rice, frozen foods, vegetables, chicken and pork. She hopes that through this financial assistance, she can keep her variety store as a profitable and viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items for her general store

loans.name: Jeyssel

texts.en:
Jeyssel has been a store owner for one year. She also raises hogs as an additional source of income. Her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW).

Jeysse is now 26 years old and has one child. Because she doesn't have many competitors within her local community, she decided to increase her grocery stock.

To make her goal possible, she is seeking additional capital of PHP15,000. She will be using this amount to buy cases of soft drinks, frozen foods, liquified petroleum gas (LPG) and other grocery items to sell.

Jeysse hopes to obtain the said amount of loan money for the further growth of her variety store and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use:
to buy soft drinks, frozen foods, Liquified Petroleum Gas (LPG) and other grocery items to 
sell.
